subject: Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()
messages: [{'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-01-29 22:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-01-31 09:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nAfter some IRC talks we decided to go ahead with this'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-01-31 09:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-01-31 10:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 22:14:48.000000000', 'message': "Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Conflicts:
	ovsdbapp/schema/open_vswitch/commands.py

Change-Id: I62d6fc2a209535227686a2397b8f7cb169e7d35b
Closes-bug: 1813213
"}]
commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Conflicts:
	ovsdbapp/schema/open_vswitch/commands.py

Change-Id: I62d6fc2a209535227686a2397b8f7cb169e7d35b
Closes-bug: 1813213

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-25 13:58:43.000000000', 'message': 'Secure dnsmasq process against external abuse

Currently any dhcp agent instance will work as an open resolver. For
deployments using publicly routed addresses for tenant networks, this
allows the agent being abused in dDoS attacks, see [1].

By setting the `--local-service` option dnsmasq will filter DNS queries
and reply only to queries from directly attached networks.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206

Conflicts:
    neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py

Closes-Bug: 1501206
Change-Id: I76d810aad2ce0f15a88bd798963012fa0efca74e
(cherry picked from commit 0fce3ca2c1641fbcfb8327a86d7225e2c3972263)
'}]
commit_message:
Secure dnsmasq process against external abuse

Currently any dhcp agent instance will work as an open resolver. For
deployments using publicly routed addresses for tenant networks, this
allows the agent being abused in dDoS attacks, see [1].

By setting the `--local-service` option dnsmasq will filter DNS queries
and reply only to queries from directly attached networks.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206

Conflicts:
    neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py

Closes-Bug: 1501206
Change-Id: I76d810aad2ce0f15a88bd798963012fa0efca74e
(cherry picked from commit 0fce3ca2c1641fbcfb8327a86d7225e2c3972263)

commit_message:
use payloads for all SUBNETPOOL_ADDRESS_SCOPE events

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for SUBNETPOOL_ADDRESS_SCOPE events.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Change-Id: I9048b2026571694eb39279e3c0fc1d598ee1fd05

commit_message:
Set the ip tool path for each OS

The ip tool on different operating systems is in different paths. This
PR creates a hash with each distro family which is used to set the path
correctly across each distro.

Change-Id: I0f691865b569d7e8b72a15d45cd8547dea45d5d5
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Explicitly set project_id when creating an SG rule

Seems like patch [1] changed the way SG rule creation requests are
evaluated in Neutron. We fail with 404 if we don't specify the
project_id. This patch aims to solve this by explicitly setting it in
both LB handler and namespace SG driver.

This needs a fix for network policy handler/drivers as well.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628691

Partial-Bug: 1813756
Change-Id: Iad910a551c57fb77e2dbd661e3167fd61a2fc07d

Add CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE capability for privsep

CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE was added (like in nova and neutron) to fix cinder backups
on kernel v4.15.

Change-Id: Iabe0cf9761e4d7e1d62c51c601c283faf7048691
Closes-Bug: 1808682
(cherry picked from commit 12c6a8c6304cc6e22a61e8eec2344036b46097e2)

commit_message:
Build tinyipa with tinycore 8.x

Upgrading to a more recent tinycore distribution to prepare
support to deliver a tinyipa image with ironic-python-agent
built with python 3

Most important changes in Tinycore 8.x include:
* kernel updated to 4.8.17
* glibc updated to 2.24
* support for Python 3.6

This patch also removes the need of get-pip.py script in
favor of native pip installation

Change-Id: I9f2f5d9faca7cbf736547b0d0ec39c5c2bb554bc
Story: #2002598
Task: #29131

commit_message:
Support for conductors exposed from API

Adds conductor resource to the CLI, the support to list and show
conductor resource, and filter nodes by conductor field.

Story: 1724474
Task: 28066

Change-Id: I9644b9b1bbe2f4f5aa6e80a6bb7ab9b0a4663a6f

commit_message:
Add is_smartnic to Port data model

To allow the use of Smart NICs on baremetal nodes it is required to mark
an ironic port as a Smart NIC, this change implement the changes required
for adding port attribute 'is_smartnic' in Port object and data model
alongside with migration scripts and unit tests.

Story: #2003346

commit_message:
Remove uses of logger name "oslo_messaging"

The old olso namespace package logger config should not be used as
stated by [1], this patch removes the redundant one.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/master/oslo_log/log.py#L466

Change-Id: I58401867cfe34b1becd438702888e3875602b38d

Failed connect to www.percona.com:443; Connection timed ou'}, {'account_id': 16282, 'date': '2019-01-30 19:05:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

kolla-build-centos-source gate job failed with the following


INFO:kolla.common.utils.base: ---> Running in 2391fd5306f9
INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[91mcurl: (7) Failed connect\x1b[0m
INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[91m to www.percona.com:443; Connection timed out
INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[0m
INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[91merror: https://www.percona.com/downloads/RPM-GPG-KEY-percona: import read failed(2).
INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:\x1b[0m
INFO:kolla.common.utils.base:Removing intermediate container 2391fd5306f9
ERROR:kolla.common.utils.base:Error'd with the following message
ERROR:kolla.common.utils.base:The command '/bin/sh -c rpm --import https://artifacts.elastic.co/GPG-KEY-elasticsearch     && rpm --import https://packages.grafana.com/gpg.key     && rpm --import https://repos.influxdata.com/influxdb.key     && rpm --import https://packagecloud.io/gpg.key     && rpm --import https://www.percona.com/downloads/RPM-GPG-KEY-percona     && rpm --import /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/PERCONA-PACKAGING-KEY     && rpm --import https://packages.treasuredata.com/GPG-KEY-td-agent' returned a non-zero code: 1"}, {'account_id': 16282, 'date': '2019-01-30 19:40:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

tripleo-build-containers-centos-7 failing with

INFO:kolla.common.utils.placement-api:\x1b[91mchmod: cannot operate on dangling symlink '/openstack/healthcheck'
ERROR:kolla.common.utils.placement-api:The command '/bin/sh -c mkdir -p /openstack &&     ln -s /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-common/healthcheck/placement-api /openstack/healthcheck &&     chmod a+rx /openstack/healthcheck' returned a non-zero code: 1

Likely a tripleo issue"}, {'account_id': 16282, 'date': '2019-01-30 19:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

the tripleo-build-containers-centos-7 failure is unrelated to this patch'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2019-01-31 05:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-01-31 08:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for fixing Martin!'}]

commit_message:
Fix broken xtrabackup and monasca-grafana images

Percona started signing packages with a new public GPG key, without
providing it via HTTPS. Ship the PERCONA-PACKAGING-KEY extracted from
the percona-release package.

https://jira.percona.com/browse/PT-1685

monasca-grafana broken by 'rake' missing when trying to install the
'fpm' gem.

Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>
Change-Id: Ica9867448dc20864f2fd4614a295a23a4a625af4
Closes-Bug: #1813906
Closes-Bug: #1813927

commit_message:
Release neutron-lib 1.23.0

Release the latest code from neutron-lib so that we can begin to
consume it in networking related projects.

Change-Id: Ifde392d17f71b0a3645375b9e2adecc4b378bb22

Publish a better failure message for Update Ansible

This review return and publish a better failling message
back to the client with the log path in order to make
the debuging easy.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 14:54:39.000000000', 'message': "Correct *_short_bootstrap_node_name variable.

The pacemaker/notify-rabbitmq.yaml and pacemaker/rpc-rabbitmq.yaml
services where making use of the *_short_bootstrap_node_name variables
considering that their service_name matched their template file name.
However, their service_name is oslo_messaging_rpc and oslo_messaging_notify
respectively. So the variables weren't found when executing the tasks.

Change-Id: I3b851a6e8463b1debf56ca8dca201dbac2d8d3c9
Closes-Bug: #1813617
"}]
commit_message:
Correct *_short_bootstrap_node_name variable.

The pacemaker/notify-rabbitmq.yaml and pacemaker/rpc-rabbitmq.yaml
services where making use of the *_short_bootstrap_node_name variables
considering that their service_name matched their template file name.
However, their service_name is oslo_messaging_rpc and oslo_messaging_notify
respectively. So the variables weren't found when executing the tasks.

Change-Id: I3b851a6e8463b1debf56ca8dca201dbac2d8d3c9
Closes-Bug: #1813617

[{'created': '2019-01-22 22:10:56.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: add ability to write ignition configuration

Ignition does not use configuration drives, it uses an OEM partition.
While we could place such data in user_data in a configuration drive,
only a single file is needed for ignition.

Depends-On: I71e2819c5240ac3ddbe3f2defbfa4974090e17ce
Change-Id: I20a7e26362426aa2b7fd3d65fead713972f00ddf
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: add ability to write ignition configuration

Ignition does not use configuration drives, it uses an OEM partition.
While we could place such data in user_data in a configuration drive,
only a single file is needed for ignition.

Depends-On: I71e2819c5240ac3ddbe3f2defbfa4974090e17ce
Change-Id: I20a7e26362426aa2b7fd3d65fead713972f00ddf

commit_message:
UX - Useful error msg if role is not in roles data

If the user specify a role name that does not exist
in the provided roles data the scipt exits with a
StopIteration error. Catch it and raise RuntimeError
with user friendly error message.

Closes-Bug: #1812530
Change-Id: I704316f66c197668a7d8e373efe00889776d2a85

commit_message:
flatten the iscsid service

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for the iscsid service.

Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

Change-Id: I4a06c86da88618f9c88c5a9161dab771a82cc7d3

commit_message:
Add irrelevant-files for integrated test jobs

Cinder gate run integrated test jobs even on doc,
tests file etc changes
Example- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/600442/

We do not need to run integrated tests jobs on such changes.
Adding corresponding irrelevant-files will save infra resource.

Change-Id: I4dc57dfda6c705b5e3b5413254202b3a5b3f3d96

Please mention at least a (Story/Closes-Bug/Related-Bug):
as mentioned on https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

Current description is ambigue and fails to mention at least
one specific command that needs it.

Please read https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html



I seen that you raise like 20-30 identical changes wihout even having a story for these, please abandon them as they overload our CI and they are not even following our guidelines.

When attempting wide updates like this you always need to have a tracking ticket bug or story and start with 1-2 first and only when these are merged you can start scaling the changes to the bulk of the other repositories that (may) need it.'}, {'account_id': 25553, 'date': '2019-01-31 07:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: Ifaa4bd28337d0e28ba8c7134be619b02c54a1ed2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-25 20:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'add post-upgrade hook to readonly SA token secret

Before, the secret was not getting installed when upgrading from a
previous version of this chart without the secret. On clean install it
was working.

Now, with the addition of the post-upgrade hook this chart will install
the secret correctly when upgrading from a previous version without this
secret.

Change-Id: Ia3af5af8bcf28cae3ad31f427068a025a5a4c7fd
'}, {'created': '2019-01-28 20:28:25.000000000', 'message': 'add post-upgrade hook and deletion policy to readonly SA token secret

Before, the secret was not getting installed when upgrading from a
previous version of this chart without the secret. On clean install it
was working.

Now, with the addition of the post-upgrade hook this chart will install
the secret correctly when upgrading from a previous version without this
secret.

The deletion policy is required for sequential upgrades. Tiller
does not keep track of resources installed via post-{install,upgrade}
hooks, this causes an "Already exists" error when upgrading without this
hook. With this hook, the secret will be deleted before upgrading,
which will then install this resource.


Change-Id: Ia3af5af8bcf28cae3ad31f427068a025a5a4c7fd
'}]
commit_message:
add post-upgrade hook and deletion policy to readonly SA token secret

Before, the secret was not getting installed when upgrading from a
previous version of this chart without the secret. On clean install it
was working.

Now, with the addition of the post-upgrade hook this chart will install
the secret correctly when upgrading from a previous version without this
secret.

The deletion policy is required for sequential upgrades. Tiller
does not keep track of resources installed via post-{install,upgrade}
hooks, this causes an "Already exists" error when upgrading without this
hook. With this hook, the secret will be deleted before upgrading,
which will then install this resource.


Change-Id: Ia3af5af8bcf28cae3ad31f427068a025a5a4c7fd

IP allocation was initially deffered due to lack of binding
information. On port update the with both `mac_address` and
`binding_host_id`` in the request 'fixed_ips: []' was
appended to the new_port data when. This caused the check
for fixed_ips_requested to return True, which in turn cause
deferred_ip_allocation to evaluates False.

Move the call to update_port_with_ips() so that it executes
only if the initial IP allocation was not deffered.

Closes-Bug: #1811905

commit_message:
Fix port update deferred IP allocation with host_id + new MAC

IP allocation was initially deffered due to lack of binding
information. On port update the with both `mac_address` and
`binding_host_id`` in the request 'fixed_ips: []' was
appended to the new_port data. This caused the check for
fixed_ips_requested to return True, which in turn cause
deferred_ip_allocation to evaluates False.

Only set the new_port default fixed_ips to original_ips if
the original port had fixed_ips.

Closes-Bug: #1811905
Change-Id: If98a82f8432b09a29f9d0cc6627e9649b43bc4a1

commit_message:
Feature sets for sahara-scenario

Implement feature sets for scenario tests. A feature
- automatically loads additional default files if available
  when -p and -v are used;
- selects also specific EDP jobs which matches the specified
  tags, in addition to EDP jobs without tags.

For more details, check the referenced story and also the
original spec:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/sahara-specs/specs/sahara-tests/sahara-scenario-feature-sets.html

Story: 2004691
Task: 28702
Change-Id: Ic3e2e5d3f37d5bb7002605dcd2de3fdd892dc8bc

commit_message:
Handle single ip port on dual-stack

In the case of dual-stack network, users might create a container
with existing neutron port. In before, kuryr assumes the
existing port is a dual-port (with both v4 and v6 addresses)
but this assumption is not always true. In face, it is
possible to create a v4 only port in a dual-stack network and
use it as an existing port.

This commit handle the case that the container is created from
a dual-net with a specified v4-only port. In this case, kuryr
will create a v6 port in ipam_request_address as a place holder.
The v6 port will be removed at network_driver_create_endpoint.

NOTE: the change in kuryr_libnetwork/tests/fullstack/test_ipam.py
is cherry picked from commit 89485dc390f4857464506550c2f4a38ab22ac8ae
for fixing the job 'kuryr-libnetwork-fullstack-py35'

Related-Bug: #1800375
Change-Id: Id988abf1b6560332b18a60d99658a8768d46c343
(cherry picked from commit 68cb29267a1b0db19c31709959c2b2e88501780d)

commit_message:
Handle single ip port on dual-stack

In the case of dual-stack network, users might create a container
with existing neutron port. In before, kuryr assumes the
existing port is a dual-port (with both v4 and v6 addresses)
but this assumption is not always true. In face, it is
possible to create a v4 only port in a dual-stack network and
use it as an existing port.

This commit handle the case that the container is created from
a dual-net with a specified v4-only port. In this case, kuryr
will create a v6 port in ipam_request_address as a place holder.
The v6 port will be removed at network_driver_create_endpoint.

Related-Bug: #1800375
Change-Id: Id988abf1b6560332b18a60d99658a8768d46c343
(cherry picked from commit 68cb29267a1b0db19c31709959c2b2e88501780d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 07:52:48.000000000', 'message': "Fixed using 'os_auth_ver' parameter when passed via --config

Although using 'os_auth_ver' parameter is deprecated, freezer-api (or
freezer-web-ui respectively) still uses it to generate configs for jobs.
Commit 50df2c8 introduced regression causing freezer-agent refusing to
start when config passed via '--config' contains 'os_auth_ver' parameter
(or any other deprecated option). The root cause is that loop (L568)
iterates through keys defined in config file passed via '--config'
therefore trying to call CONF.set_override with deprecated 'os_auth_ver'
as a first argument which causes oslo.config library to raise
KeyError: 'os-identity-api-version' as CONF.set_override is not expected
to be called with deprecated options. This simple patch adds call for
get for each key which may (correctly) raise NoSuchOptError for undefined
(and deprecated) keys, thus safely fallbacking to except routine.

Re-submitted.

Change-Id: Ia554d440b6256eab0f953ed9ad75cff1f040e6a1
(cherry picked from commit afbbaa2326d5e51ded7b06f7b1257e1a7807c152)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed using 'os_auth_ver' parameter when passed via --config

Although using 'os_auth_ver' parameter is deprecated, freezer-api (or
freezer-web-ui respectively) still uses it to generate configs for jobs.
Commit 50df2c8 introduced regression causing freezer-agent refusing to
start when config passed via '--config' contains 'os_auth_ver' parameter
(or any other deprecated option). The root cause is that loop (L568)
iterates through keys defined in config file passed via '--config'
therefore trying to call CONF.set_override with deprecated 'os_auth_ver'
as a first argument which causes oslo.config library to raise
KeyError: 'os-identity-api-version' as CONF.set_override is not expected
to be called with deprecated options. This simple patch adds call for
get for each key which may (correctly) raise NoSuchOptError for undefined
(and deprecated) keys, thus safely fallbacking to except routine.

Re-submitted.

Change-Id: Ia554d440b6256eab0f953ed9ad75cff1f040e6a1
(cherry picked from commit afbbaa2326d5e51ded7b06f7b1257e1a7807c152)

commit_message:
Fix E117 for pycodestyle (pep8) 2.5.0

The new 2.5.0 release of pycodestyle enforces E117
and is not managed by upper-constraints so we have
to fix the violations. Thankfully there are only a
few and they are fixed here.

Change-Id: Ic71eaf9b3552dfa6603632e556b102696c8d76e4

commit_message:
Only request certs in step 1

The certmonger-user service used to run in every step. This limits it to
only step 1.

Change-Id: I572d53bb6977e16d1deffe0127e17e48a8cda29c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-23 15:28:59.000000000', 'message': "Avoid double-setting event

In commit cc8b51e1e16f6bdc7d6c0e571e2002e70cde098d we added a send
on the old event when clearing an EventletEvent. However, this was
done unconditionally, which means if the event was already sent
then we attempt to send it again. This fails with:

AssertionError: Trying to re-send() an already-triggered event.

Similar to 14a53c4d8a9d5605b14a503803859df0d6d4b820, we should check
if self._set is True and if so then we know that the event was
already sent and we don't need to do it again.

Change-Id: I660601383072d11e4a077aada8c1b8c30b9d8d1d
Closes-Bug: 1812922
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid double-setting event

In commit cc8b51e1e16f6bdc7d6c0e571e2002e70cde098d we added a send
on the old event when clearing an EventletEvent. However, this was
done unconditionally, which means if the event was already sent
then we attempt to send it again. This fails with:

AssertionError: Trying to re-send() an already-triggered event.

Similar to 14a53c4d8a9d5605b14a503803859df0d6d4b820, we should check
if self._set is True and if so then we know that the event was
already sent and we don't need to do it again.

Change-Id: I660601383072d11e4a077aada8c1b8c30b9d8d1d
Closes-Bug: 1812922

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 02:03:54.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Fix instability with volume attachment RBAC tests

This patchset fixes instability with volume attachment
RBAC tests. The tests are currently failing due to volumes
failing to reach the expected statuses due to insufficiently
robust waiters or due to sharing of class-wide resources
(volumes, servers) [0]. Lack of resource idempotency is likely
compounding waiter issues.

So this patchset resolves the issue by creating a volume/server
per test and removing the shared class-wide versions. It also
adds a `wait_for_server_volume_swap` call to
`test_update_volume_attachment` which was previously missing
even though the test does a volume swap.

Finally, the test `test_create_volume_attachment` now
more atomically tests `attach_volume` API action by
calling the API directly in the contextmanager (while
the role is overridden) and only afterward invokes the
waiter to wait for the volume status to change.

[0] e.g. http://logs.openstack.org/21/571621/1/check/patrole-multinode-admin/395b4fb/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-01_04_06_10_109536

Change-Id: Ib78ccc3cad7689c0c5a7daf10ec5eeb2ee7a03ab

commit_message:
Fix instability with volume attachment RBAC tests

This patchset fixes instability with volume attachment
RBAC tests. The tests are currently failing due to volumes
failing to reach the expected statuses due to insufficiently
robust waiters or due to sharing of class-wide resources
(volumes, servers) [0]. Lack of resource idempotency is likely
compounding waiter issues.

So this patchset resolves the issue by creating a volume/server
per test and removing the shared class-wide versions. It also
adds a `wait_for_server_volume_swap` call to
`test_update_volume_attachment` which was previously missing
even though the test does a volume swap.

Finally, the test `test_create_volume_attachment` now
more atomically tests `attach_volume` API action by
calling the API directly in the contextmanager (while
the role is overridden) and only afterward invokes the
waiter to wait for the volume status to change.

[0] e.g. http://logs.openstack.org/21/571621/1/check/patrole-multinode-admin/395b4fb/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-06-01_04_06_10_109536

Change-Id: Ib78ccc3cad7689c0c5a7daf10ec5eeb2ee7a03ab

Determines how many commits to check based
on the $FAST8_NUM_COMMITS env variable.

If set to "smart", it uses git to try to run

Change-Id: I0adfba626ba2ea3479faf0f6ade712f14d3080d3

commit_message:
fast8 improvements

Determines how many commits to check based
on the $FAST8_NUM_COMMITS env variable.

If set to "smart", it uses git to try to run
against all unsubmitted commits.  This allows
fast8 to be more useful when actively developing
a series of patches.

Change-Id: I0adfba626ba2ea3479faf0f6ade712f14d3080d3

commit_message:
Convert base commands to ReadOnlyCommand

This adds a test for handling nested read-only execute() commands
and converts some commands that were missed.

Related-Bug: #1813213
Change-Id: I77332f1810fe09f8bce8c41cc11168b15923ecce

commit_message:
Move Fujitsu ETERNUS DX related file

Since there are three volume driver files relating to
Fujitsu ETERNUS DX in cinder.volume.drivers.fujitsu,
Due to the need to distinguish from the new series,
I make 'eternus_dx' directory at cinder.volume.drivers.fujitsu
and I move these files to the directory.

Change-Id: I605698e7cf028e4fcf4896ce676250b00ecb7c86

commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: I62d6fc2a209535227686a2397b8f7cb169e7d35b
Closes-bug: 1813213

commit_message:
Fix member address selection in lbaas driver

Currently when Senlin adds a member to load balancer's pool, it just uses
the first address of the node. In a dual stack network, if the first
address does not match with the subnet ip version, the member will become
unaccessible from the load balancer. This patch ensures the right address
will be picked according to the subnet ip version.

Change-Id: I0322184dfdb46a7560c20e85452d84d2ffb83a1c
Closes-Bug: #1813089

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-07 19:06:31.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid coreference between current state and _last_published_data

Previously, all data source drivers replace the entire state on each
poll or push update (doctor). The DSE publish code relied on this
situation to optimize performance by skipping a copy when setting
_last_published_data. The coreference introduced did not matter
because the original state was never edited, only replaced.

But beginning with the webhook drivers
(monasca webhook and vitrage), the drivers edit the current state.
This a bug was introduced where sometimes an update would not be
published to messaging bus because of an incorrect _last_published_data
due to coreference.

This patch fixes the bug. In addition, the _last_published_data
elements are stored as set rather than list to save the need to
convert to set each time a diff is needed. The times when
conversion back to list is needed to publish on the messaging bus
(used for snapshot publish only)
is expected to be far fewer than the times the conversion to set is
needed.

A few additionalogging lines are also introbuced for improved
debuggability.

Change-Id: I332a844beaf8dec4450bb1ade6ce7e41cc3d4d91

is expected to be far fewer than the times the conversion to set is

A few additionalogging lines are also introbuced for improved

Change-Id: I332a844beaf8dec4450bb1ade6ce7e41cc3d4d91
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid coreference between current state and _last_published_data

Previously, all data source drivers replace the entire state on each
poll or push update (doctor). The DSE publish code relied on this
situation to optimize performance by skipping a copy when setting
_last_published_data. The coreference introduced did not matter
because the original state was never edited, only replaced.

But beginning with the webhook drivers
(monasca webhook and vitrage), the drivers edit the current state.
This a bug was introduced where sometimes an update would not be
published to messaging bus because of an incorrect _last_published_data
due to coreference.

This patch fixes the bug. In addition, the _last_published_data
elements are stored as set rather than list to save the need to
convert to set each time a diff is needed. The times when
conversion back to list is needed to publish on the messaging bus
(used for snapshot publish only)
is expected to be far fewer than the times the conversion to set is
needed.

A few additionalogging lines are also introbuced for improved
debuggability.

Change-Id: I332a844beaf8dec4450bb1ade6ce7e41cc3d4d91

messages:
[{'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-16 22:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-10-17 17:23:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

FYI: I'm still reviewing. I think there is a simpler way to code where you don't have to have all these version checks and alternate code paths. I've been doing some testing on the python-ldap behaviors and unfortunately it looks like the bytes documentation from upstream python-ldap is not accurate. I'll update once I get the actual behavior figured out."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 17:51:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > FYI: I'm still reviewing. I think there is a simpler way to code
 > where you don't have to have all these version checks and alternate
 > code paths. I've been doing some testing on the python-ldap
 > behaviors and unfortunately it looks like the bytes documentation
 > from upstream python-ldap is not accurate. I'll update once I get
 > the actual behavior figured out.

Agreed, my approach is a bit quick and dirty. I think using bytes_mode=False for py2 would help with what you're suggesting. Although that probably might be a bit riskier in terms of regressing the existing py2 code."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 17:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 17:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-17 19:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Patch set 3 will fix most of the unit tests but the ldappool change is required to fix the rest (see Depends-On).'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:11:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

As of python-ldap 3.0 (I tested with 3.1) automatic type conversion is supported, thus you don't need all this complicated logic just to support a deprecated Python version (PY2). I recommend you keep the code clean by writing for the current PY3 version and introduce version checks only when you have no other option.

To support both PY2 and PY3 simultaneously without version checks you need to initialize ldap with these options:

bytes_mode=False, bytes_strictness='warn'

The bytes_strictness parameter needs some discussion.

First of all there is bug in the current 3.1 version of python-ldap, despite ldap.initialize() being documented as accepting the bytes_strictness parameter it does not, see this bug I filed:

https://github.com/python-ldap/python-ldap/issues/249

However, there is an easy work-around as documented in the bug report we can use for now, just make sure there is a comment in our code about removing the work-around.

As long as bytes_strictness is not 'error' python-ldap will perform automatic type conversion, thus there is no need to do that up at the application level. But the default value of bytes_strictness is 'error', thus it MUST be reset to either 'warn' or 'silent', but which should it be, 'warn' or 'silent'?

Since by default BytesWarning are not emitted by Python (ldap.LDAPBytesWarning is a subclass of  BytesWarning) it should be fine to use 'warn' instead of 'silent'.

In theory we shouldn't be getting any warnings because in theory at this point all text in PY2 should be unicode (not str) and in PY3 it should be str (not bytes). But we really ought to verify we don't have coding errors lurking that are masked by the automatic type conversion. To turn on just the ldap.LDAPBytesWarning warnings for testing purposes do this:

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('always', category=ldap.LDAPBytesWarning)"}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-10-18 01:42:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Although python-ldap with the above configuration will perform the type conversion in PY2 I think it would be a good idea to assure ourselves we don't have any coding errors. In theory if things work in PY3 then they should work correctly in PY2 with bytes=False. The ldap unit tests should check for this. It should be easy to add the check to the unit tests. Rather than having just one unit test dedicated to this we can get broader coverage by turning on the check for all the ldap unit tests. It's been a while since I looked at the ldap unit tests but I believe there is just one piece of common code that sets up the ldap connection. That would be a good place to turn LDAPBytesWarning into an exception. Thus even though the normal run time code would self correct the unit test would show us where we have a coding error. I believe this can easily be done with this one line:

warnings.filterwarnings('error', category=ldap.LDAPBytesWarning)"}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

John, thanks for the comments. Hoping to come back to this soon with your suggestions.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-19 13:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-19 13:55:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-10-19 16:53:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Corey, thanks for the updated patch. I won't have time to review it today, but I'll try to look at it Monday. After our last exchange it occurred to me you might not be familiar with the rules for encoding/decoding with LDAP and I should write them down. It's a tricky area if you're not familiar with the requirements. A very quick look at the new patch with removed code suggests there might have been some misunderstandings. But let me take a better look Monday, I'll write up the rules (seems to me I added doc on the requirements in the source file but with the new PY2 conversion support in python-ldap 3.x that doc needs to be tweaked slightly."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-19 17:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This needs the ldappool change to land before py36 unit tests will succeed.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-19 18:05:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks John and appreciate the input. I'll do my best to keep pushing on this but also if someone wanted to take it over for me I wouldn't be opposed. At the moment downstream in ubuntu we have to fix many of the py3 openstack issues ourself and it's a bit overwhelming as there are a lot. Not all upstream projects are finding py3 bugs to be a priority so are not in a rush to fix them (note this bug is triaged as a medium importance for a code path that is severely broken for py3)."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-26 17:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-26 17:22:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit 2f50b9ae126ff481f4440e917f86ca8a688c3d0f'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2018-10-30 12:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-10-30 16:01:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Please review this documentation:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#what-s-text-and-what-s-bytes

Make note of the fact attribute values are not affected by the introduction of automatic type conversion, that only applies to dn's, rdn's, filters, credentials, etc. LDAP *values* are still binary. OpenStack continues to store and retrieve LDAP values as *text*, therefore the conversion between LDAP binary data and OpenStack data must still occur.

The one exception to the rule that OpenStack retrieves values from LDAP as text occurs with boolean values."}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2018-10-30 16:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

You may also want to refer to the LDAPHandler class doc string in keystone/keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py where it discusses type conversion.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-01-10 19:35:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8116, 'date': '2019-01-10 22:17:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi Corey: I didn't have time to do a full careful review (I'll try to get to that soon) But I did skim through the patches and it looks like you're on the right track, this is much improved, it shows a much better understanding, good work."}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2019-01-11 14:52:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
PY3: switch to using unicode text values

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for some fields (DNs,
RDNs, attribute names, queries). Instead, text values are represented
as str, the Unicode text type. Compatibility support is provided for
Python 2 by setting bytes_mode=False [1].

Update the keystone LDAP backend to adhere to this behavior by using
bytes_mode=False for Python 2 and dropping UTF-8 encoding and decoding
fields that are now represented as text in python-ldap.

[1] More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Note that at a minimum python-ldappool 2.3.1 is required. For more
details see Depends-On's below.

Change-Id: Ifdd0644cd7042407a008c85c0b2c40a971c90bc3
Closes-Bug: #1798184
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/611401
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613632
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/614052

commit_message:
Expose receipt_setup and receipt_rotate command

The commands "receipt_setup" and "receipt_rotate" are used for
control receipt keys. They should be exposed to operators.

Update the cli doc in alpha order as well.

Change-Id: Id8f062ce1d713cd029a11fe8fdc81c256a771471

commit_message:
Add usage admin resource

Shows "usage" (how many of each object type exist in our DB) in total
and also broken down by both operating and provisioning status.
Global system usage is available to admins / global observers, while
per-project usage is also available to any project admin.

Change-Id: I616497a296d96ccea8904a825fcdc3777663b7e2

commit_message:
[Calico] Configuration robustness improvements

No longer use networking.settings.ippool.ipip.mode, rather take from
conf.node.CALICO_IPV4POOL_IPIP (this avoids duplication and
possibility of setting them differently).

Logging values previously required Titlecase in some places, lower in
others (and it changed across versions); have the chart DTRT where it
matters to avoid configuration problems.

Change-Id: Idb7ccb5be8f9e1cb184ed86a9fd0875704912564

subject: Make etcd loadbalancer optional
messages:
[{'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-12 03:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-12 04:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-06-12 06:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-06-12 18:51:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Have y'all considered switching to conditionals instead of resource type mappings in the environment?

https://docs.openstack.org/heat/latest/template_guide/hot_spec.html#conditions-section"}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-06-12 21:09:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I had a few driver refactor ideas like the conditional in mind but would require a few other changes. For the conditional, the heat templates would need be upgraded to at least 2016-10-14 | newton. They are currently Juno 2014-10-16 I think.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-12 21:10:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Zane, thanks for the comments. We will definitely consider that direction.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-12 21:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Jim, yes, totally agree with you. The only thing we should keep in mind is, heat template is the core of Magnum for deployment, so we should be very careful to do the upgrade because our current test coverage is not good for the e2e testing against COE.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-28 04:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-06-28 20:06:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

These changes would undo some floating ip optional changes. Please consider this case :)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-06-28 21:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, I know. So please keep an eye on this patch ;) Cheers.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-07-01 21:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-08-02 00:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-08-02 00:07:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Jim, I think I need some help here and seems the feature's scope is bigger than I thought."}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-08-02 17:06:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Feilong, sounds good I'll have a look."}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-09-25 22:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

https://github.com/openstack/magnum/blob/master/magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/calico-service.sh#L10

how would this work in this case for calico?'}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-09-25 23:00:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I think if we can get this solved, we'd completely do this. Huge boost to reliability!"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2018-09-25 23:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Given the calico service bash script will be run on master, so I think we can just use the localhost address for etcd service?'}, {'account_id': 28411, 'date': '2018-09-25 23:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So being a daemonset, the containers will run on the minions. We dont have localhost endpoints for etcd available on the minions to interact with. Is this something you have?'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-12-06 23:02:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Instead of removing the etcd lb, i think we could re-use the master lb for etcd cluster as well but in a different listener. However, this approach has pros and cons.

Pros: 
- the cloud resource consumption reduced
- the master `--etcd-servers` option can be easily configured in an HA manner (instead of the current 127.0.0.1:2379 which etcd service down will cause the api server down)

Cons: 
- the etcd cluster is exposed to the public if the k8s API is public. 
- the traffic between k8s api and external will be mixed with traffic between k8s and etcd.

Some kind of trade-off need to be made though.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-01-30 21:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

easily login to master nodes to access the etcd service. It's not necessary

commit_message:
Make etcd loadbalancer optional

Based on current design, Magnum will create LB with VIP for etcd. However,
given the etcd cluster is created for k8s cluster dedicately and user can
easily login to master nodes to access the etcd service. It's not necessary
to provide a loadbalancer for etcd, especially given it will cost at least
2 VMs and 1 floating ip. So this patch is going to make the etcd loadbalancer
optional for backward compatibility.

Task: 21672
Story: 1775684

Change-Id: I8b24b406b9b114a0754b1fca8d18c39f2e50e5c6

commit_message:
Add openstack/windmill-backup

This project builds on to windmill, but will be used to provide optional
backup support. We'll be using both ansible-role-borgbackup and
ansible-role-borgmatic to accomplish this.  We do not plan to release to
pypi at this time, and all testing will be in tree.

Change-Id: I273c7436f25b7e467221dbf80ce1ef281d97a38e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Release Glance 18.0.0b1
messages:
[{'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-01-24 15:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-24 16:51:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Sounds like a good reason to do a beta release.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-28 17:36:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK, here's what I think we need to do timing-wise:
1 - merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632517/ (adds the test to make sure pbr and the alembic migration constant are in sync)
2 - merge this change, which should cause the next set of glance unit tests to fail
3 - merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632185/ (which will correct the alembic migration constant and restore glance tests to passing)"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-01-29 01:37:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> OK, here's what I think we need to do timing-wise:
 > 1 - merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632517/ (adds the test
 > to make sure pbr and the alembic migration constant are in sync)
 > 2 - merge this change, which should cause the next set of glance
 > unit tests to fail

Does this imply that you'd like 632517 included in the B1 tag?

 > 3 - merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632185/ (which will
 > correct the alembic migration constant and restore glance tests to
 > passing)"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-29 07:55:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Does this imply that you'd like 632517 included in the B1 tag?
 > 

Important question, impossible to review without this answer :)"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:21:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Tony and J-P: good questions, I'll check with Sean and Erno."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-30 15:40:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

From what I understand, Brian has the order right. Whether or not we include 632517 shouldn't really matter. The key thing is that after the beta release and the major version has bumped to 18, Glance will need to account for that in the migration test."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:31:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Sean: thanks!  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632517/ has merged, so this should be ready to go.

WARNING: I believe that once this is merged, the next Glance patch will fail, as will anything running Glance unit tests.  So we need to be ready to immediately merge https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632185/ .  The emergency fallback (in case that doesn't fix the gate breakage) will be to revert https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632517/

We need to be sure that glance cores are on watch to take care of the above when this patch is merged."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:39:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is no reason to include the test to the beta release.

What we really just want to make sure with the test is that we do remember to open the migrations for the new cycle once the major version is bumped. (At this point when we are currently working on it, the order even does not really matter, what really matters is that we remember to do it on Train milestone 1.)

Actually I rather do not have the test included in the beta release as checking out that tag will render the output untestable (due to that test breaking as the migration version will not match).'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-30 20:53:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Handle 'is_public' filter in volume-type list

If the resource is `volume_type` then `is_public=None`
is the default filter passed with it.
This filter should be handled by the general filtering
function which was included to volume type list code
introduced in MV 3.52.
If there is only one invalid_filter (is_public) and
the resource is volume_type then no exception should be
raised.

Change-Id: I7759a24895d5dac4306263712a40711cb8d06c7c
Closes-Bug: #1808620

commit_message:
Fix indentation for new pycodestyle E117

There was an over indented method in openstackcloud.py#L3099 [1]
that the new pycodestyle E117[2] is catching[3].

This patch corrects the indentation to allow pep8/flake8 to pass.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/cloud/ \
    openstackcloud.py#L3099
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/master/CHANGES.txt#L9
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/56/633856/2/check/openstack-tox-pep8/5c57397/ \
    job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-30_15_27_16_765029

Change-Id: I20fd50195ca6aa6ba67ba15e7ba1155acb18d4eb

Support configuring LVM on the seed hypervisor

This allows operators to easily provide storage space for the seed VM.

Change-Id: Ibcb1a5b0d34f2456459604e3a0f3303d93810afb
Story: 2004756
Task: 28862

(5 comments)

some readability suggestions inline'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-12 22:53:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

Hi, thank you for your submission. My main concern with this change is how it affects the older APIs.  We strive to maintain backwards compatibility on our APIs and while our APIs are not perfect, we don't want to introduce inconsistencies in older, published APIs. 

I noticed the work in cinder (example: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573093) seems to enforce Schema validation from a particular microversion. Did you consider this approach?"}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-07-17 16:25:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

@Goutham:  So are you suggesting that we introduce a new microversion, 2.xx for "add json query validation of request body for share-type apis" and (1) before that microversion leave the existing non-schema-based validation in place, (2) at or after it do the validation currently run via  @validation.schema(schema_share_types.base_create_v241, '2.41') ?'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2018-07-17 21:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> @Goutham:  So are you suggesting that we introduce a new microversion, 2.xx for "add json query validation of request body for share-type apis" and (1) before that microversion leave the existing non-schema-based validation in place, (2) at or after it do the validation currently run via  @validation.schema(schema_share_types.base_create_v241, '2.41') ?


Absolutely Tom, I think that approach would greatly reduce the code complexity. We can leave the older APIs untouched and begin validating only from a particular version... 

While I'm not strongly opposed to DongDong Pei's current approach; I want to know if this can be simpler so we can cover the whole manila API faster; while delivering good user experience. 

DongDong Pei: What is your opinion on this? Do you have a timeline/plan for the rest of the manila APIs?'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-01-30 19:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hi Dongdong Pei, are you still interested in continuing this work?'}]

commit_message:
V2 jsonschema validation: base framework & share-types

This patch adds a base jsonschema framework which will be used
by other subsequent patches for adding jsonschema validation
support for Manila APIs.

This patch also adds jsonschema validation for below share-types APIs
* POST /v2/{tenant_id}/types
* POST /v2/{tenant_id}/types/{share_type_id}/action

Change-Id: I40b0734a95513afc577fe403c24a33a1ca8a1925
Partial-Implements: json-schema-validation

commit_message:
Status blocked until ceilometer-upgrade action

Currently it is unclear that ceilometer is not actually ready when it
is related to gnocchi until the ceilometer-upgrade action has run. The
status will show active Unit is ready when it is not.

When gnocchi is related, check that the ceilometer-upgrade action has
been run. If not set workload status to prompt the administator to run
the action.

Please merge the charm-helpers change first:

commit_message:
Revert "Update reference for puppetlabs-apache"

The required commit is available since tag: 3.3.0,
current released tag is 4.0.0, so let's consume it.

This reverts commit 791074a9a1c6c7216ceec576a002f334712eee17.

Change-Id: Icd6bef8d717c14e3271657779bf0589208a2aea5

We may want to consider keeping the bionic jobs in check queue and moving the CentOS jobs to experimental.

commit_message:
Add Ubuntu Bionic CephFS jobs

We need these for python3 support since the CentOS
jobs will not run correctly under python3.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/627037/
Change-Id: I0e4baaaca5046f9c0ee32cf3de78133f743fd66d

commit_message:
Disable nova-lxd tempest plugin

The nova-lxd plugin tries to use the pylxd module to connect to the
LXD instance on the compute node. This will fail when tempest is
run in a container or with a multi node deployment.

Change-Id: I588d3eb430112beda6398c218b20a851d9288a4c

Yes, I was wondering which part of the chicken should land before the egg. So... gerrit/ first then zuul/ ?'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-01-15 16:29:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I very much want to use the multi-tenant support in Zuul, though I seem to recall a desire to wait until Zuul has moved to opendev.org so that the dashboard URL makes a bit more sense (not to mention the repo orgs, etc.).  At least, that's the message I got when I started talking about a Zuul tenant for Zuul."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-01-15 16:33:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I very much want to use the multi-tenant support in Zuul, though I
 > seem to recall a desire to wait until Zuul has moved to opendev.org
 > so that the dashboard URL makes a bit more sense (not to mention
 > the repo orgs, etc.).  At least, that's the message I got when I
 > started talking about a Zuul tenant for Zuul.

Note that zuul.opendev.org can be implemented as a vhost on zuul.openstack.org. This should be a relatively straightforward change to our existing puppet for zuul.openstack.org but will require a new ssl cert."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-01-15 16:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-15 16:46:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If we are not ready to support a full separate tenant just yet, we could WIP this one and I could propose a temporary change to define two Kata-specific pipelines in the openstack tenant. Would that be OK with y'all?

That would allow Kata to enable those two new Zuul jobs ASAP, while we work on that transition. I'm happy to help with the base-jobs split in parallel."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-15 17:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-15 17:34:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

We need base-jobs split first'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-18 10:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-18 10:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

We need base-jobs split first'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-23 20:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-23 21:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-29 10:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-01-30 13:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-01-30 14:14:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-01-30 14:22:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

waiting for depends-on to merge'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2019-01-30 16:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Define a specific Zuul tenant for Kata containers

As Kata containers starts using Zuul more and more, it will require
the definition of specific pipelines. Defining a specific Zuul
tenant for Kata will avoid overloading the OpenStack pipelines.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/632785
Change-Id: Icfa0bc192447203744b90f25fe4aa4ac694d4405

Default handler for installing deb from resources

Add handler for installing a deb which has been provided via Juju
resources in the Ceph Storage charm.

Rename the client routines for sfc to more generic name

Rename the client routines used for SFC resources to a generic
name so that other plugins/extensions can reusee those routines

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-30 08:06:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix gate failures by a new pycodestyle

pycodestyle 2.5.0 introduces E117 over-indented.
This commit fixes E117 errors.

pycodestyle 2.5.0 also drops pep8.py. As a result,
horizon/test/unit/hacking/test_checks.py starts to fail.
The equivalent elements are provided by pycodestyle.py,
so we can consume pycodestyle instead of pep8 module.

Change-Id: Ib103998f42ce7c901a10669b771a898783ca1a92
'}]
commit_message:
Fix gate failures by a new pycodestyle

pycodestyle 2.5.0 introduces E117 over-indented.
This commit fixes E117 errors.

pycodestyle 2.5.0 also drops pep8.py. As a result,
horizon/test/unit/hacking/test_checks.py starts to fail.
The equivalent elements are provided by pycodestyle.py,
so we can consume pycodestyle instead of pep8 module.

Change-Id: Ib103998f42ce7c901a10669b771a898783ca1a92

[{'created': '2018-10-04 17:10:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix whitespace in neutron.conf template

The Jinja2 templating code can introduce whitespace which ends up in
front of the `# General, applies...` comment. This leads to a parsing
error when Neutron is started and the Neutron installation playbook
fails. Note that this change leaves _more_ whitespace in the beginning
of neutron.conf, but preserves the newline in front of the comment.

Change-Id: Ib9a9e44f25dcabb92df6067852e91115d30fe740

commit_message:
Fix whitespace in neutron.conf template

The Jinja2 templating code can introduce whitespace which ends up in
front of the `# General, applies...` comment. This leads to a parsing
error when Neutron is started and the Neutron installation playbook
fails. Note that this change leaves _more_ whitespace in the beginning
of neutron.conf, but preserves the newline in front of the comment.

Change-Id: Ib9a9e44f25dcabb92df6067852e91115d30fe740

commit_message:
Add test for data migration version

Detect when the CURRENT_VERSION constant used by the database
migration code is out of sync with the version number of the
current release.

commit_message:
Update cirros from 3.5 to 3.6

Current 3.5 cirros image is giving sh: write error: No space left
on device error leading to tempest scenario tests failures as
config-drive setup fails. It fixes the same.

Related-Bug: #1808010

Change-Id: I8a6230a8d8bac7cfbd3c11a3a3b508878e5e1741

Publish error for package_update workflow

The package_update workbook need to publish the execption
when something failed with heat stack update

commit_message:
Always generate stackviz irrespective of tests pass or fail

Stackviz provides a nice report of all the tempest testst.
In current implementation, stackviz playbook is called
only when there is a tempest pass result otherwise on failure
tempest_run playbook calls assert and abort the playbook and
then stackviz playbook does not runs.

This patch enables to run stackviz playbook irrespective of the
tempest tests passes or fails.

It also moves stackviz installation to tempest_install.yml and
gather datas to tempest_run.yml.

Change-Id: I682277ec9ebd02ba98837677b6f0a900e4581f5d

commit_message:
Don't include libvirtd on pause/resume

libvirt needs to be running even when the pause action runs, this allows
commands like "virsh secret-list" run and having it running is safe
enough from a nova-compute unit point of view, because it won't touch
the already running instances.

Change-Id: Idec9e2b7c6275c4c5485942574120289552f2955
Closes-Bug: 1802917

commit_message:
Adding default theme on AVAILABLE_THEME even if custom is enabled.

In case custom theme imports default theme's scss file, upgrading
openstack-dashboard pkg causes compression error. By adding default
theme to AVAILABLE_THEME list, collectstatic collects proper default
theme files to /var/lib/openstack-dashboard/static/ and custom theme
can import proper files.

Importing default theme's files seems to be normal when someone wants
to modify default theme a little not creating whole theme.

Closes-Bug: #1812148

Change-Id: Ic1aa03387814a57dde876aa6d95e64b555152b7c

commit_message:
Allow charms to specify mandatory_config.

Allow a charm to specify config options that must be set. The charm
can do this by creating a list of config options called
mandatory_config. The check is run everytime assess_status is called.

Change-Id: I2bb9d2d873e1916624a26c08b036a16e91195b86

commit_message:
Add 'tbkey' param

Currently if the traceback is held at a different key it will be
silently ignored, leading to rather frustrating loglines like Internal

commit_message:
[WIP] [CEPH] CheckPGs filter fix

In Ceph v13.2.4 and above, the output for --json-pretty changes in
such a way that grep is not adequate. We will now use jq, as this
is much more portable.

Change-Id: Ia6bff7c4d97684b66979d3ed6a372d72127828a0

[{'created': '2019-01-29 09:03:33.000000000', 'message': 'Disable nova-lxd tempest plugin during nova-lxd test

The test tries to use the pylxd module to connect to the LXD instance
on the compute node which will fail when tempest is run in a container
or for a multi node deployment.

Change-Id: I35bb2f2bc2b06fedcdf2ab6b3a6147eec0795989
'}]
commit_message:
Disable nova-lxd tempest plugin during nova-lxd test

The test tries to use the pylxd module to connect to the LXD instance
on the compute node which will fail when tempest is run in a container
or for a multi node deployment.

Change-Id: I35bb2f2bc2b06fedcdf2ab6b3a6147eec0795989

commit_message:
Reject interface attach with QoS aware port

Attaching a port with minimum bandwidth policy would require to update
the allocation of the server. But for that nova would need to select the
proper networking resource provider under the compute resource provider
the server is running on.

For the first iteration of the feature we consider this out of scope. To
avoid resource allocation inconsistencies this patch propose to reject
such attach interface request. Rejecting such interface attach does not
break existing functionality as today only the SRIOV Neutron backend
supports the minimum bandwidth policy but Nova does not support
interface attach with SRIOV interfaces today.

A subsequent patch will handle attaching a network that has QoS policy.

Co-Authored-By: Elod Illes <elod.illes@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: Id8b5c48a6e8cf65dc0a7dc13a80a0a72684f70d9
blueprint: bandwidth-resource-provider

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625799/ is affected by this?'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-01-03 07:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Currently tripleo-upgrade rocky branch is blocked until this patch gets merged.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-03 12:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Matthew, there is a genuine reason for this: thre are projects that do not have per-release branches but they do use openstack requirements based on the tested target release.

This means that we need to backport any new blacklist in order to be able to run their code.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-03 13:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2019-01-03 13:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-01-08 10:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2019-01-08 10:51:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-08 13:44:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorin, do you know what projects do not use branches yet test against stable requirements? This seems like an issue that needs to get fixed.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-08 14:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am not sure I understand that question. Still, I do not see any reason for not adding the missing linter to the blacklist.

The reason is simple: if linting changes are not backported it will be really hard to backport other changes, mainly because we would likely
lose the ability to "cherrypick to branch" due to conflicts.

AFAIK, blacklist file contains linters so I see no restrictions for updating their list. Nothing got shipped from here, but they are needed for testing the code, on all supported branches.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-09 16:31:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

given it's linter and it's blacklist we should be fine adding it, but as sean asked, we do need to figure out what to do with 'non-stable-follows-policy' projects using requirements (which is for stable-follows-policy as one of it's objectives).  I'd like the second vote here to be from the stable team (or at least an ack).  I'll bring this up at our meeting today."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-01-09 16:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It seems that bashate is also missing from the magic list, even if is a linter made by us.

Thanks for taking care of this.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-01-09 18:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 22895, 'date': '2019-01-30 13:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 0bcf78fcfc779152507a99ffaaa3d57240c4fd8f'}]

tripleo ones.

(cherry picked from commit 13abf68ae724de24351220fffed702797bdec83a)

subject: ec2-api: add stable/stein branch
messages:
[{'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2019-01-30 07:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2019-01-30 07:09:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-30 12:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This seems really early to be adding a stable/stein branch. Can you comment on why you would like to create that now?'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2019-01-30 12:27:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I made rocky branch half-year ago https://review.openstack.org/#/c/587212/ ...
so I thought that now it's a time to add next branch :)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-01-30 12:30:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

With the slightly longer Stein cycle, we still have almost two months until the RC1 deadlines, which is typically when stable branches are cut.

https://releases.openstack.org/stein/schedule.html

If you do not expect any other changes to go into ec2-api we can certainly cut that branch now, but it might be safer to wait until the deadline week to do it in case something comes up.

The biggest drawback would be if there is anything that needs to be merged, it would need to merge to master first, then get cherry picked to stable/stein.'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2019-01-30 12:38:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

ok, I'll wait with this. thank you!"}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2019-01-30 12:38:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add Bionic compatibility for the NRPE scripts via libmonitoring.

From Bionic onwards, libnagios is replaced by libmonitoring. Trusty only
contains the former, Bionic only the latter. Xenial contains both, but
we prefer libmonitoring where it exists, so that we can drop libnagios
support entirely once Trusty goes EOL.

Change-Id: I613fd0b29b797e8900581f939eda72a1ab72868b
Closes-Bug: 1796143

[{'created': '2019-01-28 16:50:26.000000000', 'message': "Pentest:Infra Pentest - NoVNC - X-Frame Options Not Set 3.0.3.

The server should send an X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff to make sure
the browser does not try to detect a different Content-Type than what is
actually sent (can lead to XSS).

Additionally the server should send an X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN to protect
against drag'n drop clickjacking attacks in older browsers.

Change-Id: I1efd5b54b9c9a5d581b4f02b83c01db048e2589e
"}]
commit_message:
Pentest:Infra Pentest - NoVNC - X-Frame Options Not Set 3.0.3.

The server should send an X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff to make sure
the browser does not try to detect a different Content-Type than what is
actually sent (can lead to XSS).

Additionally the server should send an X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN to protect
against drag'n drop clickjacking attacks in older browsers.

Change-Id: I1efd5b54b9c9a5d581b4f02b83c01db048e2589e

commit_message:
Use tempest_cloud_name in tempestconf

Currently on doing tempest_use_tempestconf to true, It depends on
keystone specific parameters which is not defined in os_tempest
role leading to undefined variables. Since os_tempest has nice
support of clouds.yaml for all tempest resource creation,
tempestconf also have the same and almost all openstack installers
have the same. Let's use it the same in python-tempestconf for
generating tempest.conf.

Change-Id: I498a3362ec917a3d6c9c67986770e623e6cefec2

commit_message:
Fix help text for [kafka]url option

The "url" is for the kafka cluster, not the zookeeper cluster.

Change-Id: I29c898b4e39fd25f54572248c0cf8638afcc7f92

In general I'm OK with adding a policy check on using these filters, I'm just not sure if we should piggyback on the existing get_all_tenants one or add a new rule."}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2017-12-08 03:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hey Matt, thanks for the feedback. Happy with either approach so are you able to tell me whether this should have a new policy rule or utilise an existing one?'}, {'account_id': 11869, 'date': '2017-12-08 08:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-08 14:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

> Hey Matt, thanks for the feedback. Happy with either approach so are you able to tell me whether this should have a new policy rule or utilise an existing one?

I think we want a new rule, we could maybe call it something like "expanded_filters" or something and by default it's admin only.

I've left some more comments inline about other assumptions in the code about admin-only like the 'deleted' filter, we would have to account for that I think, right?

This is probably worth some discussion in the mailing list since I don't want to make a unilateral decision on this.'}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2017-12-11 00:50:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> I think we want a new rule, we could maybe call it something like
 > "expanded_filters" or something and by default it's admin only.

OK sounds good 

 > I've left some more comments inline about other assumptions in the
 > code about admin-only like the 'deleted' filter, we would have to
 > account for that I think, right?

Yeah I guess this new policy rule could also include the deleted filter.
 
 > This is probably worth some discussion in the mailing list since I
 > don't want to make a unilateral decision on this.

OK will do'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2017-12-11 03:33:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Ideally it should be same filter list for admin and non-admin which we want to do but need more discussion.

For this fix-  With policy control (old or new rule), we are changing the whitelist of filter for non-admin case. Which makes 2 different whitelist for non-admin if policy is allowed and if not allowed.

I am not 100% sure if that is right/clear behavior as general. I suggest we should try to make the same whitelist for both admin and non-admin. but that need version bump or not we need discussion.  

And yes, there are other cases for upgrade etc where it can break users if we use exiting policy rule but not with new rule.

let's discuss this more on API meeting.

FYI- In Ocata, there was another modification we tried to make on 'all_tenants' filter where it will not return 403. And introduced new single rule and deprecated old rules [1] but that did not happen due to more discussion needed.

..1 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426128/1"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2017-12-11 13:38:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Allow ability for non admin users to use all filters on server list.

Adds a new policy rule "os_compute_api:servers:allow_all_filters"
to control whether a user can use all filters when listing servers.

Closes-bug: #1737050

Change-Id: Ia5504da9a00bad689766aeda20255e10b7629f63

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 06:10:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix string interpolations in logging calls

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled
by the logging code, rather than being done
at the point of the logging call.

* https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

The check rule for string format method will be added
in openstack/hacking.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I6ec56ec35bcb33d6627a47b66c4f7fc2c6f22658
'}]
commit_message:
Fix string interpolations in logging calls

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled
by the logging code, rather than being done
at the point of the logging call.

* https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

The check rule for string format method will be added
in openstack/hacking.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I6ec56ec35bcb33d6627a47b66c4f7fc2c6f22658

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-25 22:10:50.000000000', 'message': "Handle special cases with msgpack and python3

We attempt to be clever about string types in the token formatters.
We do this because in some cases, not all items in a token payload
are serialized to byte strings. To add flexibility for this, we use
tuples with a boolean value that denotes if the accompanying value is
a byte string or not. This helps us safely re-inflate the value from
a byte string back to it's .hex representations, typically with UUID
strings.

With python3, we actually hit an interesting case where what we pass
into the token payload doesn't actually maintain that state due to the
usage of msgpack. The msgpack library returns byte strings even though
the initial value may not have been a byte string. This breaks the
logic we have for the associated boolean value because the string type
changes and the boolean does not.

This commit adds a couple of if/statements to detect if we running on
python3 and if the boolean mismatches the actual value type. Then, it
attempts to do the right thing by decoding the string.

We should think about how we want to do this, or if there is a better
way.

Change-Id: Iaecd45ef985cbf5ff4a6a724df96c1304a927247
Closes-Bug: 1813085
"}, {'created': '2019-01-25 22:21:10.000000000', 'message': "Handle special cases with msgpack and python3

We attempt to be clever about string types in the token formatters.
We do this because in some cases, not all items in a token payload
are serialized to byte strings. To add flexibility for this, we use
tuples with a boolean value that denotes if the accompanying value is
a byte string or not. This helps us safely re-inflate the value from
a byte string back to it's .hex representations, typically with UUID
strings.

With python3, we actually hit an interesting case where what we pass
into the token payload doesn't actually maintain that state due to the
usage of msgpack. The msgpack library returns byte strings even though
the initial value may not have been a byte string. This breaks the
logic we have for the associated boolean value because the string type
changes and the boolean does not.

This commit adds a couple of if/statements to detect if we running on
python3 and if the boolean mismatches the actual value type. Then, it
attempts to do the right thing by decoding the string.

We should think about how we want to do this, or if there is a better
way.

Change-Id: Iaecd45ef985cbf5ff4a6a724df96c1304a927247
Closes-Bug: 1813085

We do this because in some cases, not all items in a token payload
are serialized to byte strings. To add flexibility for this, we use
tuples with a boolean value that denotes if the accompanying value is
a byte string or not. This helps us safely re-inflate the value from
a byte string back to it's .hex representations, typically with UUID
strings.

into the token payload doesn't actually maintain that state due to the
usage of msgpack. The msgpack library returns byte strings even though
the initial value may not have been a byte string. This breaks the

changes and the boolean does not.

python3 and if the boolean mismatches the actual value type. Then, it
attempts to do the right thing by decoding the string.

We should think about how we want to do this, or if there is a better
