commit_message:
Handle special cases with msgpack and python3

We attempt to be clever about string types in the token formatters.
We do this because in some cases, not all items in a token payload
are serialized to byte strings. To add flexibility for this, we use
tuples with a boolean value that denotes if the accompanying value is
a byte string or not. This helps us safely re-inflate the value from
a byte string back to it's .hex representations, typically with UUID
strings.

With python3, we actually hit an interesting case where what we pass
into the token payload doesn't actually maintain that state due to the
usage of msgpack. The msgpack library returns byte strings even though
the initial value may not have been a byte string. This breaks the
logic we have for the associated boolean value because the string type
changes and the boolean does not.

This commit adds a couple of if/statements to detect if we running on
python3 and if the boolean mismatches the actual value type. Then, it
attempts to do the right thing by decoding the string.

We should think about how we want to do this, or if there is a better
way.

Change-Id: Iaecd45ef985cbf5ff4a6a724df96c1304a927247
Closes-Bug: 1813085

commit_message:
Improve kayobe --version output

This was hardcoded to 0.1. This change will report the full version
of the package including suffixes indicating VCS status.

Change-Id: I43b92e4d5b2aee22d7c6282f81701e5f83912f50
Story: 2004663
Task: 28630

commit_message:
Add missing tag for puppet-tripleo

The lack of tag prevent the right event chaining as defined
in Tripleo::Firewall class.

Closes-Bug: #1813900

Change-Id: I92ca278952127d81809df6e6ddb6383e98e802f0

commit_message:
Set keystone specific vars for os_tempest from clouds.yaml

By using os_client_config module, we are getting standalone clouds
details and we can use the same for setting keystone specific
vars for os_tempest role till https://review.openstack.org/631967
gets merged.

Change-Id: Ie7b3d58bcbdc07ccdd5cb8a0c6ddd098ff2c7e04

commit_message:
Remove a bare raise noticed by the linter

There is a bare raise in a function that is used as an exception
handler.  Remove it and have the caller raise inside it's except
block instead.

Change-Id: Ib494d320e1c2e6cc6daa20255e30291fc2e258e8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Ensure django.contrib.auth.middleware monkey patching for APIMockTestCase

This patch is directly proposed to stable/rocky.

A cherry-pick of I6b2be31568e4aa4273990f9cfa76ca139620c84b
to stable/rocky is insufficient. The cherry-pick forgot to
handle APIMockTestCase as the corresponding code is different
between the master branch and stable/rocky branches and
as a result APIMockTestCase in stable/rocky branch does not
monkey-patch django.contrib.auth.middleware.

Related-Bug: #1806053
Change-Id: I4993ff5006b6366df64b6d96acddf15be0cc331c

commit_message:
Update CI jobs in sync with migration in congress repo

- Run newly migrated congress-tempest-* jobs from congress repo.
- Hold legacy jobs and playbooks deleted from congress repo. They
are used to run jobs against stable branches. Can be removed when
all supported stable branches use new style jobs.
- Fixes the problem where stable branch jobs do not correctly use
the specified branches.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631609/
Change-Id: I03cfb7a1dae0ee3fab70be61203fc07f324e8a41

[{'created': '2019-01-18 22:34:00.000000000', 'message': 'Enable monasca in py2 tempest CI job

On bionic, there seems to be a kafka bug which causes some failures
on certain versions of JRE [1].
As a result, the JRE install invoked by Congress devstack plugin
causes Monasca devstack plugin to fail. Here we remove the JRE install
from Congress devstack plugin and enable monasca devstack plugin in
the CI job.

Note: Java is used to generate code for Congress, but not currently
required in Congress devstack install.

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36970622/kafka-unrecognized-vm-option-printgcdatestamps

commit_message:
Enable monasca in py2 tempest CI job

On bionic, there seems to be a kafka bug which causes some failures
on certain versions of JRE [1].
As a result, the JRE install invoked by Congress devstack plugin
causes Monasca devstack plugin to fail. Here we remove the JRE install
from Congress devstack plugin and enable monasca devstack plugin in
the CI job.

Note: Java is used to generate code for Congress, but not currently
required in Congress devstack install.

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36970622/kafka-unrecognized-vm-option-printgcdatestamps

Change-Id: Ibce028cb5635fe52275968beb5b4305f855ea851

commit_message:
Enable z3 on ubuntu bionic tempest tests

Previously disabled because the z3 github does not
provide binaries for bionic. However, the binaries
for xenial appear to work fine for testing purpose,
so we enable z3 with some additional logic that
substitutes xenial binary.

Change-Id: If6d775d07ea816157c62b78e3185f1e7f242e20c

commit_message:
migrate legacy dsvm jobs to non-legacy

Jobs now inherit from non-legacy tempest-all job.
Move ubuntu jobs from xenial to bionic.
Renamed job names according to zuul v3 convention.
Removed legacy playbooks.

TODO: add separate z3 job for xenial because z3 git
currently do not offer precompiled binary for bionic.

TODO: enable monasca, which is currently causing some
problems in bionic.

Change-Id: Ied99ea945782f480c86535588552bbe68be7a23a

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-10 10:40:09.000000000', 'message': 'WIP read conf options from alternate ini file

Early patch for the wsgi loader to explore some of the ideas discussed
here [1] towards using oslo.config for swift option parsing.

Have the wsgi loader merge options found in an alternate conf file
that uses regular ini format, so that middleware sections are named
without the "filter:" prefix. This format would be more in keeping with
the conventions used in other projects.

e.g. the alternate file might have:

    [dlo]
    rate_limit_after_segment = 20
    # rate_limit_segments_per_sec = 1
    max_get_time = 86401

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/swift_oslo-config

Change-Id: Iaebb5919fe791c4045e16e4c4a4bc9a62c903902
'}]
commit_message:
WIP read conf options from alternate ini file

Early patch for the wsgi loader to explore some of the ideas discussed
here [1] towards using oslo.config for swift option parsing.

Have the wsgi loader merge options found in an alternate conf file
that uses regular ini format, so that middleware sections are named
without the "filter:" prefix. This format would be more in keeping with
the conventions used in other projects.

e.g. the alternate file might have:

    [dlo]
    rate_limit_after_segment = 20
    # rate_limit_segments_per_sec = 1
    max_get_time = 86401

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/swift_oslo-config

Change-Id: Iaebb5919fe791c4045e16e4c4a4bc9a62c903902

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 18:10:08.000000000', 'message': 'Do not allow pre-release version of neutron

In stable/rocky if the requirements.txt contains 13.0.0.0b2, then it
allows to pick up pre-releases of neutron (now, 14.0.0.0b1) instead
of latest stable on rocky (13.0.2).

However this might come up again when there will be a 14.0.0 stable
version.

Also adapt lower constraints to match with newer neutron requirements.

Change-Id: I34273ba08b20af49bf60869816176719082995c1
'}, {'created': '2019-01-15 18:31:58.000000000', 'message': 'Do not allow pre-release version of neutron

In stable/rocky if the requirements.txt contains 13.0.0.0b2, then it
allows to pick up pre-releases of neutron (now, 14.0.0.0b1) instead
of latest stable on rocky (13.0.2).

However this might come up again when there will be a 14.0.0 stable
version.

Also adapt lower constraints to match with newer neutron requirements.

Change-Id: I34273ba08b20af49bf60869816176719082995c1
'}, {'created': '2019-01-17 17:00:52.000000000', 'message': 'Upper-constrain neutron to stable/rocky

If neutron version is not restricted to stable/rocky then pip would
install latest master, which causes conflicts in test runs [1].

One thing that could mitigate this problem would be to import neutron_lib
instead of neutron (as service). neutron_lib is introduced exactly to
solve this kind of problems. See details [2] from Requirements team.

Lower constraints also updated.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-odl/stable/rocky/openstack-tox-py27/ded9e09/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-17_06_19_33_595226
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/requirements-libs

Change-Id: I34273ba08b20af49bf60869816176719082995c1
'}]
commit_message:
Upper-constrain neutron to stable/rocky

If neutron version is not restricted to stable/rocky then pip would
install latest master, which causes conflicts in test runs [1].

One thing that could mitigate this problem would be to import neutron_lib
instead of neutron (as service). neutron_lib is introduced exactly to
solve this kind of problems. See details [2] from Requirements team.

Lower constraints also updated.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/networking-odl/stable/rocky/openstack-tox-py27/ded9e09/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-17_06_19_33_595226
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/requirements-libs

Change-Id: I34273ba08b20af49bf60869816176719082995c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-30 02:06:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix revert a volume from a snapshot

when we revert a volume from a snapshot, using snapshot.metadata in cinder.volume.utils.py will
result in this error:

  AttributeError: 'Snapshot' object has no attribute '_obj_metadata'
here, appending 'metadata' to usage_info is meaningless
Therefore, we delete 'metadata' while reverting.

Change-Id: I6eed3b11dd249429f1e1b72304535fa1d2be0a2d
Closes-Bug: #1805790
"}]
commit_message:
Fix revert a volume from a snapshot

when we revert a volume from a snapshot, using snapshot.metadata in cinder.volume.utils.py will
result in this error:

  AttributeError: 'Snapshot' object has no attribute '_obj_metadata'
here, appending 'metadata' to usage_info is meaningless
Therefore, we delete 'metadata' while reverting.

Change-Id: I6eed3b11dd249429f1e1b72304535fa1d2be0a2d
Closes-Bug: #1805790

commit_message:
Update reference for puppetlabs-apache

Also added the reference in external_modules.txt
so it's taken care with Puppet Openstack Modules Constraints
update job.

This pin is required by scenario-py3 Fedora job, the pin
can be removed once the hash is in a tag release.

Change-Id: Iacb3fd2e17ba4a69dad4fdb906b65db5b04dbb2e

commit_message:
Huawei driver refactor(1/10)

Huawei driver code is terribly decayed and hard to maintain.
From this patch on, we'll try to progressively refactor total
Huawei driver, make the code more clear, reliable and maintainable.

This patch mainly optimized the huawei_conf.py file and the logic
that according to it.

Change-Id: I5da3e2a8b1bae4502ae4025a931e9c6899c81e56

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-25 13:58:19.000000000', 'message': 'Secure dnsmasq process against external abuse

Currently any dhcp agent instance will work as an open resolver. For
deployments using publicly routed addresses for tenant networks, this
allows the agent being abused in dDoS attacks, see [1].

By setting the `--local-service` option dnsmasq will filter DNS queries
and reply only to queries from directly attached networks.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206

Conflicts:
    neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py

Closes-Bug: 1501206
Change-Id: I76d810aad2ce0f15a88bd798963012fa0efca74e
(cherry picked from commit 0fce3ca2c1641fbcfb8327a86d7225e2c3972263)
'}]
commit_message:
Secure dnsmasq process against external abuse

Currently any dhcp agent instance will work as an open resolver. For
deployments using publicly routed addresses for tenant networks, this
allows the agent being abused in dDoS attacks, see [1].

By setting the `--local-service` option dnsmasq will filter DNS queries
and reply only to queries from directly attached networks.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501206

Conflicts:
    neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py

Closes-Bug: 1501206
Change-Id: I76d810aad2ce0f15a88bd798963012fa0efca74e
(cherry picked from commit 0fce3ca2c1641fbcfb8327a86d7225e2c3972263)

commit_message:
Put image name sections in sorted order

Sort entries in overcloud_containers.yaml.j2 to make it
easier to compaire the generated content with output from
docker images or another sorted order list of image names

nova-compute-ironic and nova-compute

ceilometer-ipmi and ceilometer-notification

mistral-executor and mistral-event-engine

Change-Id: Ife47ee9e1adfdc703cfac9ed9b0ea07d1781e035

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-28 23:11:19.000000000', 'message': '[Prometheus] Relax some timing constraints

Relax the timing constrains for disk IO and also the API server to
accommodate rotating disk speeds and busy systems.

Change-Id: Ifb067a2218528e5918d2f4b2ba169b6e739084e0
'}, {'created': '2019-01-29 06:44:42.000000000', 'message': '[Prometheus] Relax disk IO constraints

Relax the timing constrains for disk IO to accommodate rotating disks;
a "measured IO" might be the result of a small number of physical IOs,
allow for enough time for a small number of disk rotations (this isn't
perfect but seems to be about right in testing under load).

Change-Id: Ifb067a2218528e5918d2f4b2ba169b6e739084e0
'}]
commit_message:
[Prometheus] Relax disk IO constraints

Relax the timing constrains for disk IO to accommodate rotating disks;
a "measured IO" might be the result of a small number of physical IOs,
allow for enough time for a small number of disk rotations (this isn't
perfect but seems to be about right in testing under load).

Change-Id: Ifb067a2218528e5918d2f4b2ba169b6e739084e0

commit_message:
In process-templates script write output files to provided dir when using base path

When running the process-templates script with both the -o OUTPUT_DIR and
-p BASE_PATH options the output files were not being written to the output
directory.  This fix splits out the file path from the base path to properly
write the files.

Change-Id: I845e8a2cbd2b12a4a1552b2cfa3ac013466da6bd
Closes-Bug: #1794769
(cherry picked from commit 47f47c1deaca950bb45babb5c0bb799897273413)

commit_message:
Raise exception on systemd failures

Currently paunch doesn't check exit codes on systemd operations. This
patch catch exceptions so errors are visible in the log.

Change-Id: I43c4291caf3c8ec07529ee264a5960d84854d648

commit_message:
Handle tls endpoint for zaqar websocket client

When creating zaqar websocket client, if the endpoint has tls enabled
provide the CA to the client.

Closes-Bug: 1791970
Change-Id: I09fca4ea80ae8246f136ea6998dfc7ad1c6bb4d2
(cherry picked from commit 6639b9e5643aeaee7a17b7995fddc2fb6288b926)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 12:01:44.000000000', 'message': "Create ifcfg files for vxlan tunnel setup

VxLAN tunnel is created by running the ip and ovs-vsctl commands
directly. So when the node is rebooted to apply the kernel args,
ansible fails as the node's IP is lost. This patch writes the ifcfg
files on the target nodes so that node is back to normal state, even
after reboot.

Change-Id: I3145ea1d7b98ef82693cf012d588313a95a10839
"}]
commit_message:
Create ifcfg files for vxlan tunnel setup

VxLAN tunnel is created by running the ip and ovs-vsctl commands
directly. So when the node is rebooted to apply the kernel args,
ansible fails as the node's IP is lost. This patch writes the ifcfg
files on the target nodes so that node is back to normal state, even
after reboot.

Change-Id: I3145ea1d7b98ef82693cf012d588313a95a10839

[{'created': '2019-01-29 13:09:23.000000000', 'message': 'Autocreate CephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup

Originally the playbook failed to make user aware that they need
to create the CephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup. However, if they
specified the path, then they should know about the directory.
Autocreate it so that the user only needs to specify a path.

Change-Id: I06eca1cf8987c9366492973cbe861e1a6b47f744
(cherry picked from commit 7f6f64b8be1648948086422b759a3a7993349e2c)
'}]
commit_message:
Autocreate CephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup

Originally the playbook failed to make user aware that they need
to create the CephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup. However, if they
specified the path, then they should know about the directory.
Autocreate it so that the user only needs to specify a path.

Change-Id: I06eca1cf8987c9366492973cbe861e1a6b47f744
(cherry picked from commit 7f6f64b8be1648948086422b759a3a7993349e2c)

commit_message:
Default embedded instance.flavor.is_public attribute

It is possible that really old instances don't actually have this
attribute defined which can lead to raising exceptions when loading
their embedded flavors from the database.

This patch fixes this by defaulting these values to true if they
are not set.

Change-Id: If04cd802ce7184dc94f94804c743faebe0d4bd8c
Closes-Bug: #1789423
(cherry picked from commit c4f6b0bf6cc903cf52c4b238c3771604dda174b8)
(cherry picked from commit c689c09996c4a3da9e05ccd5178a4b5060949889)
(cherry picked from commit 61bf7ae5795a3dfac7afc57bed9b4195cfdb6042)

[{'created': '2019-01-24 03:26:09.000000000', 'message': 'Raise 403 instead of 500 error from attach volume API

Currently, the libvirt driver has a limit on the maximum number of
disk devices allowed to attach to a single instance of 26. If a user
attempts to attach a volume which would make the total number of

commit_message:
Raise 403 instead of 500 error from attach volume API

Currently, the libvirt driver has a limit on the maximum number of
disk devices allowed to attach to a single instance of 26. If a user
attempts to attach a volume which would make the total number of
attached disk devices > 26 for the instance, the user receives a
500 error from the API.

This adds a new exception type TooManyDiskDevices and raises it for the
"No free disk devices names" condition, instead of InternalError, and
handles it in the attach volume API. We raise TooManyDiskDevices
directly from the libvirt driver because InternalError is ambiguous and
can be raised for different error reasons within the same method call.

Closes-Bug: #1770527

Change-Id: I1b08ed6826d7eb41ecdfc7102e5e8fcf3d1eb2e1

This PS adds support for tls secrets on non-fqdn overriden hosts
in ingress rules.

commit_message:
Add support for Oslo.Reports

Oslo Reports enables OpenStack projects to dump Guru Meditation
Reports with useful debugging information on live services
to files or stderr.

Change-Id: I901a622c470dc191864e33996986f176d40e439d

commit_message:
Fix a topology bug in flavors support

This patch fixes an oversight in the addition of flavors support in the
amphora driver[1]. The amphora-agent configuration file was still getting
the topology selected in the configuration file as opposed to the
topology selected in the flavor.

This is an additional patch at the end of the chain as it leverages
changes that were made in later flavor patches that pass the flavor
into the taskflow flow.

A follow on patch will address spares pool amphora.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/621323

Change-Id: I4c2b398b562970f128e06794690ffd7c2977db08

commit_message:
Add compute flavor support to the amphora driver

This patch adds a new flavor capability to the amphora driver called
'compute_flavor'. This allows an amphora flavor to specify a compute
(nova) flavor to be used for the load balancer instances.

Change-Id: I8626eebd906c935a47d3e3510d1dfefae307c4e9

commit_message:
Update the amphora driver for flavor support.

This patch updates the amphroa driver to pass the flavor dictionary
over to the controller worker at load balancer creation time.
This flavor dictionary is then inserted into the load balancer
creation flow.

Change-Id: I615937fdf9edf335fb18999f1b7c11eb6202a3d1

[{'created': '2019-01-18 18:11:22.000000000', 'message': "Avoid using 'truncate' on Windows

The Windows SMB driver has been broken by a recent change [1],
which is attempting to handle info file permissions, using the
'truncate' command along the way, which is not available on Windows.

We're not handling file permissions on Windows, so we can just skip
this step, avoiding this issue.

Change-Id: I1f92cef19cd2eed7ba845210f7ff89d88ba78f49
Closes-Bug: #1811369
(cherry picked from commit 133617828c37db78bcc71c5106c90818e0bebc3c)

commit_message:
Avoid using 'truncate' on Windows

The Windows SMB driver has been broken by a recent change [1],
which is attempting to handle info file permissions, using the
'truncate' command along the way, which is not available on Windows.

We're not handling file permissions on Windows, so we can just skip
this step, avoiding this issue.

Change-Id: I1f92cef19cd2eed7ba845210f7ff89d88ba78f49
Closes-Bug: #1811369
(cherry picked from commit 133617828c37db78bcc71c5106c90818e0bebc3c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-18 18:11:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix permissions with NFS-backed snapshots and backups

Fix snapshot issues that occur if cinder does not have regular (non-root)
write permission on an NFS share. This is done by following the volume
driver's model of creating files as root, followed by calling
_set_rw_permissions().

Fix backup issues that occur if cinder's group ID changes, which can
happen when migrating from bare metal to a containerized service. If the
share's group ownership and permission needs to be modified, then do it
recursively so that previously made backups remain accessible.

Closes-Bug: #1807760
Change-Id: I6c20c4825af0a365b6a20fb633c810c2f2fe48b0
(cherry picked from commit 1fb342cba89e63d15dde9db2136bdf34b549e559)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix permissions with NFS-backed snapshots and backups

Fix snapshot issues that occur if cinder does not have regular (non-root)
write permission on an NFS share. This is done by following the volume
driver's model of creating files as root, followed by calling
_set_rw_permissions().

Fix backup issues that occur if cinder's group ID changes, which can
happen when migrating from bare metal to a containerized service. If the
share's group ownership and permission needs to be modified, then do it
recursively so that previously made backups remain accessible.

Closes-Bug: #1807760
Change-Id: I6c20c4825af0a365b6a20fb633c810c2f2fe48b0
(cherry picked from commit 1fb342cba89e63d15dde9db2136bdf34b549e559)

commit_message:
Blacklist setuptools 40.7.0

Setuptools 40.7.0 introduced support for non-ascii chars in setup.cfg [1],
which causes python2.7 based sphinx jobs to fail with str-unicode mismatch,
e.g. with [2]:

'error: 'builder' must be a list of strings (got u'html,man')

See issue [3].

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt

[1] https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/history.html#v40-7-0
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/keystone/stable/queens/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/0ea4957/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-28_06_18_25_401045
[3] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/1653

Change-Id: I8921639cc4a1edfa0ac9d46a7cc03549aa6189aa
(cherry picked from commit 5989f404c1e405c29b09cd2aba6342ed84ab7856)

commit_message:
Enable health checks after failed operation

- Always call policy post_op and set 'action_result' before post_op
  call for both cluster actions and node actions.
- Each policy needs to decide inside post_op if it needs to perform its
  operation depending on action_result
- Ignore ValueError exception when removing timer from threadgroup

Change-Id: I9d5880f8e5aa12792eabe7509b2bb5626e27179c
Closes-Bug: #1811161

commit_message:
Liveness probes for OpenVSwitch daemons.

Uses ovs-vsctl for ovs-db
Uses ovs-appctl for ovs-vswitchd as "ovs-vsctl show" does not
talk to ovs-vswitchd.

Change-Id: Ia0b84e3546ff1693676ca61370e1344d75b6e308

commit_message:
Migrate patrol jobs to bionic(Ubuntu LTS 18.04)

This commit switch the patrole gate testing on Bionic (Ubuntu LTS 18.04)
from stein onwards.

patrole use base jobs from Tempest so we do not need to override the
nodeset. All magic happen with Tempest/Devstack base jobs (Depends-On patch).

Stable branch testing jobs like patrole-member-rocky on xenial for
backwards compatibility.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/618169/

Change-Id: I7e3ec9079da98e111aa750004a284a0257cb86ce

commit_message:
Fix CKM_AES_GCM encryption

This patch fixes a parameter mismatch bug when using the CKM_AES_GCM
mechanism.  This bug also renames the 'generate_iv' option to
'aes_gcm_generate_iv' to reflect the fact that it only applies to
the CKM_AES_GCM mechanism since IVs will always be generated when
using CKM_AES_CBC.

commit_message:
Enable port security

Since we enable port security by default[1] in Neutron we need to let
tempest know to use it.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/blob/51b654cf5753f3ba56650bcae7e2ad87e4b9ad4d/templates/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini.j2#L8

Change-Id: I695d671dd6bf866f844a13e5f47f6f2903497cf2

commit_message:
Support Keystone AuthN and AuthZ for k8s

Now cloud-provider-openstack of Kubernetes has a webhook to support
Keystone authorization and authentication. With this feature, user
can use a new label 'keystone-auth-enabled' to enable the keystone
authN and authZ.

DocImpact
Task: 21637
Story: 1755770

Change-Id: I3d21ad8f55c0d7308a302f62db9e9af147a604f8
(cherry picked from commit 59da4e25a6a31e296f8ad734395a791015769424)

commit_message:
Adds tempest run command with --test-list option

In scenarios of setUpClass & tearDownClass failure
the xml output generated by tempest/subunit is inaccurate.
Generating a test-list will provide an accurate list of
tests that tempest attempted to execute based on all flags
passed to the 'tempest run' command.

Related-Bug: #1812254

Change-Id: I3eccee1c7b2c04c5766e713b1179bc645d3ccb82

commit_message:
Helm-Toolkit: Make ingress manifest work for more than public endpoints

This PS enables the ingress manifest function to work for all endpoints
rather than just public.

Change-Id: I3b454bb24a763f51896e845b767fd9d28f5b07dc
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

Do not recheck, the gate is blocked due to some changes in keystone.common.policy..., I'm trying to understand how to fix the problem"}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2019-01-10 18:43:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2019-01-16 08:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Do not recheck, the gate is blocked due to some changes in
 > keystone.common.policy..., I'm trying to understand how to fix the
 > problem

It's failing because Keystone recently changed the policy enforcement scope for the failing policies to "system". But system scope patch set isn't merged in Tempest yet: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604909/

This means Patrole is using admin scope to validate the policy enforcement but global admin will of course be allowed to do something even if system admin cannot (it used to work because it was global admin).'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-01-22 07:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Do not recheck, the gate is blocked due to some changes in
 > > keystone.common.policy..., I'm trying to understand how to fix
 > the
 > > problem
 > 
 > It's failing because Keystone recently changed the policy
 > enforcement scope for the failing policies to "system". But system
 > scope patch set isn't merged in Tempest yet: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/604909/
 > 
 > This means Patrole is using admin scope to validate the policy
 > enforcement but global admin will of course be allowed to do
 > something even if system admin cannot (it used to work because it
 > was global admin).

I did not get this completely. Keystone system scope checking is not enabled by defaults right? oslo_policy.enforce_scope is false by default and system scope checking should be only warning not the error. That is why Tempest gate works fine even not requesting the system scoped operation with system scope. 

I am wondering why admin role is marked as not-allowed role for these failed operations when system scope should not be checked untill enabled explicitly.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-01-23 04:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

so the direct rule check on oslo.policy[1] fail because create_domain (and other rules) rule from keystone is return as "(role:admin and system_scope:all)" which is new policy with system scope. 

When test run the same operation with admin role it allow the operation because system scope checking is skipped which is not enabled by default but when patrole does the direct checking of rule permission with oslo.policy, system_scope: all goes as oslo.policy_checks.GenericCheck and fail because passed cred does not have system scope (which is what felipe mentioned that it is not yet implemented on tempest side). 

One way to fix this till we have the system scope support in tempest, We can skip the system scope checking on direct permissions check via oslo.policy but I am not sure how to do that. anyone else has any idea ?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/cd2c5fdbb9c4565b9e0ca30009e567e013587048/patrole_tempest_plugin/policy_authority.py#L298'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-01-23 15:11:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

Felipe, Ghanshyam,
Just system_scope isn't enough, there are another changes with brakes the Patrole.
Now `admin` implies `member` implies `reader`[0] which makes impossible to the direct rule check for roles - admin role isn't allowed for rule `role:member` and member role doesn't work with rule `role:reader`.
I did some experiments in the patch I0d0de2a20b03548a7e5dab1ee7af7b72651abcb6 and it fails if I just add system_scope
I prepared a new patch set with extending roles, please take a look.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/commit/d44ed7f18cac6bd7c44a0cba5ca2bf4d6ce8c4d4"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-01-25 01:44:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Felipe, Ghanshyam,
 > Just system_scope isn't enough, there are another changes with
 > brakes the Patrole.
 > Now `admin` implies `member` implies `reader`[0] which makes
 > impossible to the direct rule check for roles - admin role isn't
 > allowed for rule `role:member` and member role doesn't work with
 > rule `role:reader`.
 > I did some experiments in the patch I0d0de2a20b03548a7e5dab1ee7af7b72651abcb6
 > and it fails if I just add system_scope
 > I prepared a new patch set with extending roles, please take a
 > look.
 > 
 > [0] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/commit/d44ed7f18cac6bd7c44a0cba5ca2bf4d6ce8c4d4

humm this is confusing to me that we need extra role addition foe system scope implementation. I am debugging it locally also for reason."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-01-29 03:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

gate is unlocked now'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-01-29 03:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8911, 'date': '2019-01-29 16:20:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
In process-templates script write output files to provided dir when using base path

When running the process-templates script with both the -o OUTPUT_DIR and
-p BASE_PATH options the output files were not being written to the output
directory.  This fix splits out the file path from the base path to properly
write the files.

Change-Id: I845e8a2cbd2b12a4a1552b2cfa3ac013466da6bd
Closes-Bug: #1794769

commit_message:
Allow to configure where to deploy a Docker Registry

This commit changes the docker-registry playbook to deploy a Docker
Registry on hosts in the docker-registry group, rather than being
harcoded to deploy on the first controller.

The default location is changed to deploy on the seed as it appears to
be a good location for most deployments.

UpgradeImpact: The Docker Registry is now deployed on the seed by
default.

Change-Id: I87d02bd9556afb795c8783ed78e797fdd31fe8ca
Story: 2004820
Task: 28986

commit_message:
Limit overcloud-extras playbook runs to overcloud nodes

If a deployer modifies Kayobe playbooks included by overcloud-extras
(for example, docker-registry) to run on non-overcloud hosts (for
example the seed), `kayobe overcloud` commands running overcloud-extras
will try to run on those non-overcloud hosts as well.

Change-Id: I13dde285c3f873fdc53b90706352a9544e90a62a
Story: 2004819
Task: 28985

commit_message:
Add VLAN as a supported network type for OVN

In the latest version of OVN (2.11 or higher) VLAN is now supported.
This patch is adding VLAN as a supported network type in the validations
for OVN.

Here's the networking-ovn patch adding support for VLAN tenant network:
I419ea318c8d78726b5263eecbb1f70bb34f7d96d

Change-Id: I915eba94935199ba892a68557f39e9e291f5ee22
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Refactor PKCS#11 to allow configurable mechanisms

Allow for setting the PKCS#11 encryption and hmac algorithms
in the config file.

This patch also implements CKM_AES_CBC encryption and
decryption.

Change-Id: I847b4b17df51bc4846c37a1e19e6adec76f46b38
Co-Authored-By: Ade Lee <alee@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit df8c62aab357954000e8539ac17daea45f93ee7c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 13:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'Set a defined IP address range for tempest test public addresses

We may need to use some addresses on this subnet for interfaces and
bridges on the host, or containers. This patch defines the range
available to neutron where previously any IP in the subnet may have
been used.

Change-Id: I5a2f7351a6f08b37120f6299556fba1e810f3c9d
'}]
commit_message:
Set a defined IP address range for tempest test public addresses

We may need to use some addresses on this subnet for interfaces and
bridges on the host, or containers. This patch defines the range
available to neutron where previously any IP in the subnet may have
been used.

Change-Id: I5a2f7351a6f08b37120f6299556fba1e810f3c9d

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-28 10:52:09.000000000', 'message': 'nova-less-deploy: updates for metalsmith >= 0.9.0

* Replace image detection with the call from metalsmith
* Validate image parameters early to detect trivial errors
* Add support for specifying subnets in NICs
* Use more specific exceptions when checking for existing instances
* Drop compatibility code for nodes in < 0.9.0

Change-Id: I719082c0845b517172c309838e37a5e38a04c04c
Implements: blueprint nova-less-deploy
'}]
commit_message:
nova-less-deploy: updates for metalsmith >= 0.9.0

* Replace image detection with the call from metalsmith
* Validate image parameters early to detect trivial errors
* Add support for specifying subnets in NICs
* Use more specific exceptions when checking for existing instances
* Drop compatibility code for nodes in < 0.9.0

Change-Id: I719082c0845b517172c309838e37a5e38a04c04c
Implements: blueprint nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
docs: Update references to "QEMU-native TLS" document

Link to the "Secure live migration with QEMU-native TLS" document from
other relevant guides, and small blurbs of text where appropriate.

Blueprint: support-qemu-native-tls-for-live-migration

Change-Id: I9c6676897d27254e2e16bf7e36a74bf9f3da3832
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

subject: libvirt: A few miscellaneous items related to "native TLS"

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-15 14:13:39.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: A few miscellaneous items related to "native TLS"

  - Add a one-line summary of the config attribute
    `live_migration_with_native_tls` and a note about its version
    requirements.  Thus allowing the diligent operators, who carefully
    read the documentation, to make more informed choices.

  - Remove the superfluous "_migrateToURI3" suffix in the unit test.  In
    Nova commit 4b3e8772, we ripped out support for the older
    migrateToURI{2} APIs and just stick to migrateToURI3().  So no need
    to spell out which migration API we are using.

  - Add a TODO item in the libvirt driver to deprecate and remove
    support for VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED (and related config attribute)
    once the MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION supports "native TLS" by
    default.

Blueprint: support-qemu-native-tls-for-live-migration

Change-Id: Ic1419e443cecf94eb4f2c48894abb1a0eb9b73cb
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-01-15 14:16:39.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: A few miscellaneous items related to "native TLS"

commit_message:
libvirt: A few miscellaneous items related to "native TLS"

  - Add a one-line summary of the config attribute
    `live_migration_with_native_tls` and a note about its version
    requirements.  Thus allowing the diligent operators, who carefully
    read the documentation, to make more informed choices.

  - Remove the superfluous "_migrateToURI3" suffix in the unit test.  In
    Nova commit 4b3e8772, we ripped out support for the older
    migrateToURI{2} APIs and just stuck to migrateToURI3().  So no need
    to spell out which migration API variant we are using.

  - Add a TODO item in the libvirt driver to deprecate and remove
    support for VIR_MIGRATE_TUNNELLED (and related config attribute)
    once the MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION supports "native TLS" by
    default.

Blueprint: support-qemu-native-tls-for-live-migration

Change-Id: Ic1419e443cecf94eb4f2c48894abb1a0eb9b73cb
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add an ip address to eth12 in OSA test containers

The tempest tests need to ssh to booted virtual machines. The neutron
public network is 10.1.3.0/24, which is the flat network on br-vlan.
From the container perspective this was previously reached via the
default gateway on eth0 as there was no specific route to the
10.1.3.0/24 network.

On centos traffic is no longer being forwarded to the br-vlan flat network
via the container eth0 and host networking, but this still works for
other distributions.

This patch adds an IP address to the present, but previously un-addressed
interface eth12 in each container. This gives a direct route to the neutron
public network from the container and does not require the host network
to forward the traffic. The test setup is now more decoupled from the
host networking which should increase reliability.

Change-Id: Id8fbe05e83bc6d86f57202301e712fc4e8a17003

commit_message:
Remove non-voting job from gate

This results is wasted CI resources, so we can remove it from gate.

Change-Id: Id1f1fcf32521998826f495fc80b0d754338b0389
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
OSH-Infra: Update multinode and aio-monitoring/logging jobs

This proposes moving the multinode job to a periodic job to
match the approach used in the openstack-helm repo.

This also adds the openstack-exporter to the aio monitoring job as
it was previously missing.

This also proposes moving the aio-logging and aio-monitoring jobs
to voting

Change-Id: Idcd4544e03facdcd2430683b66bd80c79e73a372

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-22 14:45:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add proxy support to Minikube gate script

This commit introduces proxy support to the Minikube gate script by
leveraging existing `HTTP_PROXY`, `HTTPS_PROXY`, and `NO_PROXY`
environment variables.  Additionally, this adds the ability to interpret

commit_message:
Add proxy support to Minikube gate script

This commit introduces proxy support to the Minikube gate script by
leveraging existing `HTTP_PROXY`, `HTTPS_PROXY`, and `NO_PROXY`
environment variables.  Additionally, this adds the ability to interpret
DNS nameservers when running behind a proxy server and use those in
`/etc/resolv.conf` over the Google DNS servers.

Change-Id: I508dd00fb7df33945e8ee96af250a8eff9db389a

commit_message:
Use shaman again for manila

Builds for ubuntu bionic are working now.
We need newer features not yet packaged for ubuntu bionic
for python3 and ceph volume chmod support.

Change-Id: I20fa99c6f6da7d4042b50020ab0e9f34e7ac2de6

commit_message:
Allow admin to add SG rules to other tenants w/o project ID

Kuryr/Octavia depend on the ability to add security group rules to a
security group as admin without needing to specify the project ID.  That
behavior was broken with a recent change [1] and this restores the
previous behavior.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/628691

TODO: Add tempest test to ensure this contract is maintained going
forward.

Change-Id: I2c069125a66a9b11c200f188f33786d384e5ce01
TODO: Add bug reference.

commit_message:
Add Kata tenant Zuul configuration repository

In order to craete a Kata tenant in our Zuul instance,
we'll need to point it to a repository containing its
configuration (like pipeline definitions).

This is done before defining the tenant to avoid a race
on import.

Change-Id: Icd84291ca106855ddb4dd38b76b893fc696ddf10

subject: Bump SHAs for stable/pike
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-26 09:25:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-26 09:27:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Jesse, could you have a look? This was generated using the tooling in github.com/evrardjp/osa_cli_releases now. A second pair of eyes would be useful.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-01-27 01:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-01-28 10:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-01-28 13:15:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-29 12:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-29 12:42:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Yes I was doing that before.
But I like the automation we get here, as those are effectively two different topics. 

What I do is that I release in releases/ and bump the code version together, as we did in the past.

The bumping of SHA is now separate, and it is only relevant to release what's before the bump, as usual. This doesn't change it.

The advantage of splitting the process will be even more visible when we won't need to bump the in-tree version, by relying on pbr/setuptools. In that case, only the review in releases will matter."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2019-01-29 12:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-29 13:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Waiting for a patch from jesse: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633718/'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-29 13:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Workflow-1 by Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
'}]

commit_message:
ScaleIo Driver: Add _get_storage_pool_properties

Backport https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601681/ to stable/pike
was intended to repair bug 1784871, a security issue affecting
the scaleio driver. This backport introduced method
_is_volume_creation_safe, which calls _get_storage_pool_properties.

This change introduces the _get_storage_pool_properties method.
It is a squash of four commits, listed in the cherry-picks below.

Closes-bug: #1795458

(cherry-picked from c129e80cb0f985f0d16af59360affd1dc377f707)
(cherry-picked from b12b865ac5fdae72972b8f3416b56f9e7332f995)
(cherry-picked from 83c1113d0ae3e2b944ab190506ed8b9d81782532)
(cherry-picked from aa8b87a83cc5a8cfcaa3080c9a6080d8289716a4)

Change-Id: Ibf689f04884250df8844682f991ffa428ba1e728

commit_message:
Use the yaml stdout_callback for better prepare logging

Currently when the tripleo-modify-role runs a shell script which
produces a lot of output, its logged once as a no-newline-blob, and
again as one line per array item. Neither output is easy read, which makes
debugging harder.

This change switches to the yaml stdout_callback, and a verbosity
level which only prints the script output once.

Change-Id: I85fb8ca40e03f077147871fcd85536c0572d526e
Closes-Bug: #1813684

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-24 21:44:01.000000000', 'message': "Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: I62d6fc2a209535227686a2397b8f7cb169e7d35b
Closes-bug: 1813213
"}]
commit_message:
Allow read-only Commands to bypass txns in execute()

Since the ovs_idl backend maintains an in-memory copy of the DB,
read-only commands can be executed w/o creating a transaction.
Since it is possible for a function that calls execute() to be
automatically nested into an existing transaction, execute()
wasn't able to access the result since it only happens once the
parent transaction completed. Handling these read-only commands
w/o creating a transaction allows the results to be read and
avoids wasting resources by creating needless transactions.

ReadOnlyCommands can still be used in with transaction(): blocks
with no changes.

Change-Id: I62d6fc2a209535227686a2397b8f7cb169e7d35b
Closes-bug: 1813213

commit_message:
flatten the mistral service configurations

This change combines the previous puppet and docker files into a single
file that performs the docker service installation and configuration
for all mistral services.

With this patch the baremetal version of each mistral service has been removed.

Related-Blueprint: services-yaml-flattening

Change-Id: I3f2ac51c885548333299df2c92c1f8df154d241e

[{'created': '2019-01-20 19:08:25.000000000', 'message': "Support version discovery with uwsgi

When deploying manila with uwsgi, manila public endpoints
will be of the form 'http://<ipaddr>/share/...' rather than
'http://<ipaddr>/8786/...'.

Modify the client api version discovery to try the uwsgi
style endpoint and if it is not found fall back on the

commit_message:
Support version discovery with uwsgi

When deploying manila with uwsgi, manila public endpoints
will be of the form 'http://<ipaddr>/share/...' rather than
'http://<ipaddr>/8786/...'.

Modify _get_base_url method to retrieve the correct base_url
when performing operations.

Change-Id: I981792e39eccdb5436775a8456a68d1024c01240

commit_message:
Remove external_network_bridge Neutron option

Config option "external_network_bridge" in Neutron was deprecated
in Ocata cycle.
Now it is going to be removed completly with [1].
Background of the deprecation and removal is described in [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567369/
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/134859.html

Change-Id: I05522521aa4e63d6e4138cbcdb97b212664d3b81

commit_message:
ScaleIO Driver - adding cache and refactoring tests

Changing static lists to a simple cache.
Refactoring some of the unit tests to simplify maintenance.

Related-Bug: #1699573

Change-Id: Idff127801da9e286a6b634594e5577eeb9782571
(cherry picked from commit aa8b87a83cc5a8cfcaa3080c9a6080d8289716a4)

commit_message:
Blacklist setuptools 40.7.0

Setuptools 40.7.0 introduced support for non-ascii chars in setup.cfg [1],
which causes python2.7 based sphinx jobs to fail with str-unicode mismatch,
e.g. with [2]:

'error: 'builder' must be a list of strings (got u'html,man')

See issue [3].

Conflicts:
	global-requirements.txt

[1] https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/history.html#v40-7-0
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/keystone/stable/queens/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/0ea4957/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-28_06_18_25_401045
[3] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/1653

Change-Id: I8921639cc4a1edfa0ac9d46a7cc03549aa6189aa
(cherry picked from commit 5989f404c1e405c29b09cd2aba6342ed84ab7856)
(cherry picked from commit 71f60946e1d88bd1bf10b89a33fb6088070e133f)

commit_message:
Add ansible roles for managing HSM software

This patch adds two Ansible roles used to manage client software for
Hardware Security Modules (HSMs).  These roles are used in TripleO
to install HSM client software on controller nodes to enable the
PKCS#11 backend for Barbican.

Change-Id: Ifd7a46da84fb81eeff7ce2e935cc39007dddbf76
Needed-By: I9195626ea987606400f2e68bfe43ab917b4191dd

Hey Marios, so when seeing the logs in the patch where I'm testing this fix showed that we were having a bug in the upgrade_tasks: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1813617 which I addressed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/633754/1 . I added a dependency on this too, and hopefully the upgrades job will turn finally green."}]

commit_message:
Set overcloud_ssh_user to zuul in upgrades jobs.

Currently, we are using zuul user as overcloud_ssh_user during overcloud
deployment. While for upgrades, we are still passing tripleo-admin. This
is causing the upgrade prepare command to fail.

Change-Id: If4bd02dad8d69ba4c818ba8d800423bcc8ecfea4
Closes-Bug: #1813564

commit_message:
Make CinderStoragePluginCharm release aware.

The CinderStoragePluginCharm base class needs to be able to calculate
what release is dpeloyed so that the correct charm class can be
instantiated. To achieve this the release is calculate from the
version of the instaled cinder-common package.

Change-Id: I405efefb974bae8579cfe91c610f2fc4c563b787

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-22 13:02:36.000000000', 'message': 'Use "public" endpoint for the authentication URL for the keystone provider

With the removal of the 35357 port in a recent commit [1], we ended up
with an inconsistent use of public/internal bits of the URL. This breaks
in TripleO, since we still configure the admin endpoint. So, the default
port that was used (5000), doesn't work in TripleO.

To address this, we then completely remove the usage of the admin
endpoint for the provider, relying instead on the "public" endpoint
that's configured in keystone.

Typically, it will be behind a load balancer, so it'll actually point to
the internal endpoint of keystone. Which is what we really want to use.

[1] I951e863e7e7c8f409a13398b397b82ef70d7c123

Change-Id: I64cf93ab0c4ade3ae71aa3cd4aea444aff699a17
Related-Bug: #1804426

commit_message:
Use "public" endpoint for the authentication URL for the keystone provider

With the removal of the 35357 port in a recent commit [1], we ended up
with an inconsistent use of public/internal bits of the URL. This breaks
in TripleO, since we still configure the admin endpoint. So, the default
port that was used (5000), doesn't work in TripleO.

To address this, we then completely remove the usage of the admin
endpoint for the provider, relying instead on the "public" endpoint
that's configured in keystone.

Typically, it will be behind a load balancer, so it'll actually point to
the internal endpoint of keystone. Which is what we really want to use.

[1] I951e863e7e7c8f409a13398b397b82ef70d7c123

Change-Id: I64cf93ab0c4ade3ae71aa3cd4aea444aff699a17
Related-Bug: #1804426

it should not be there and breaks the SUSE CI.

commit_message:
Update all plugin urls to use https rather than git

Limited connectivity environments will not be able to clone/install
these repos via an http proxy, so change the connection method
to https.

Change-Id: I3cb3fd46b06aae23f37da14c9d37a00a9f1fdcd9

commit_message:
Use pagination detection by default

This cleans up all explicitly set ``paginated`` parameters, as they
should not be needed anymore, since pagination detection is used
automatically. The parameter ``paginated`` still stays available to have
a means for disabling a service's misbehaving pagination
implementations.

Change-Id: I0f3b2cd58c5e856b12478667d07912f813b0f9da

commit_message:
Modify the error message when unsetting gateway and setting FIP

When assiging FIP without router between the external and
removing an external gateway information from a using router,
openstackclient just return http code.
The patch shows the correct failure message when these errors displays.

Change-Id: I3546bd6b63d10db2c0ae2d643ee1aa61cd83cf29
Closes-Bug: 1760405
Closes-Bug: 1757063

commit_message:
Allow Kayobe to set kolla_external_fqdn_cacert

This variable can be used to customize the CA certificate file used as
the OS_CACERT environment variable in openrc files when TLS is enabled.

Change-Id: Ia157e91dfab176b84a53354065172cac2d60fb78
Story: 2004876
Task: 29150

When running role tests, the tox venv does not have the selinux
bindings, and they are not installable via pip. To ensure that

Change-Id: Ie8426653b4843fdae0946a49c02fa11db139fd4e

commit_message:
Ensure selinux bindings are linked into the venv

When running role tests, the tox venv does not have the selinux
bindings, and they are not installable via pip. To ensure that
Ansible is able to use the file module which requires these
bindings, we symlink them into the venv.

Change-Id: Ie8426653b4843fdae0946a49c02fa11db139fd4e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-29 12:56:31.000000000', 'message': "Fix lint checks after spec-cleaner 0.9.3 update

The update spec-cleaner 0.9.3 has caused some checks to fail in the
spec templates (actually, they should have failed before). Also,
it has introduced an issue [1], adding a workaround until it is
sorted out.

[1] https://github.com/openSUSE/spec-cleaner/issues/173

(cmurphy) Additionally, pin test dependencies and fix other linter
errors that weren't needed in the original commit.

Change-Id: Iaac66cefbf700b0116616ea70f132cf465808e2f
(cherry picked from commit 273b1e111ab7b98df320810308ca81b974ac9114)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix lint checks after spec-cleaner 0.9.3 update

The update spec-cleaner 0.9.3 has caused some checks to fail in the
spec templates (actually, they should have failed before). Also,
it has introduced an issue [1], adding a workaround until it is
sorted out.

[1] https://github.com/openSUSE/spec-cleaner/issues/173

(cmurphy) Additionally, pin test dependencies and fix other linter
errors that weren't needed in the original commit.

Change-Id: Iaac66cefbf700b0116616ea70f132cf465808e2f
(cherry picked from commit 273b1e111ab7b98df320810308ca81b974ac9114)

Add release note about ceph role changes

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-27 15:27:06.000000000', 'message': "Add setting of target dev for vif vhostuser

Nova skips detaching of ovs dpdk interfaces
thinking that it's already detached because
get_interface_by_cfg() return no inteface.
This is due to _set_config_VIFVHostUser()
not setting target_dev in configuration while
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface sets one if tag was
found.

The fix will cause get_interface_by_cfg() to
return proper interface as target_dev will be
set to vif_name in _set_config_VIFVHostUser()

Change-Id: Iaf185b98c236df47e44cda0732ee0aed1fd6323d
Closes-Bug: #1807340
"}, {'created': '2018-12-27 21:29:42.000000000', 'message': "Add setting of target dev for vif vhostuser

not setting target_dev in configuration while
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface sets one if tag was
found.

The fix will cause get_interface_by_cfg() to
return proper interface as target_dev will be
set to vif_name in _set_config_VIFVHostUser()

Change-Id: Iaf185b98c236df47e44cda0732ee0aed1fd6323d

get_interface_by_cfg() return no inteface.

not setting target_dev in configuration while
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface sets one if tag was
found.

In case net-type is vhostuser, checking if
target_dev match will be skipped.

commit_message:
Skip checking of target_dev for vhostuser

Nova skips detaching of ovs dpdk interfaces
thinking that it's already detached because
get_interface_by_cfg() return no inteface.
This is due to _set_config_VIFVHostUser()
not setting target_dev in configuration while
LibvirtConfigGuestInterface sets target_dev
if tag "target" is found in the interface.

As target_dev is not a valid value for
vhostuser interface, it will not be checked
for vhostuser type.

Change-Id: Iaf185b98c236df47e44cda0732ee0aed1fd6323d
Closes-Bug: #1807340

commit_message:
Autocreate CephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup

Originally the playbook failed to make user aware that they need
to create the CephAnsibleFetchDirectoryBackup. However, if they
specified the path, then they should know about the directory.
Autocreate it so that the user only needs to specify a path.

Change-Id: I06eca1cf8987c9366492973cbe861e1a6b47f744

[{'created': '2018-09-18 09:28:06.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - add support for native TLS encryption on NBD for disk migration

The NBD protocol previously runs in clear text, offering no security
protection for the data transferred, unless it is tunnelled over some
external transport like SSH. Such tunnelling is inefficient and
inconvenient to manage. Support for TLS to the NBD clients & servers
provided by QEMU was added. In tls-everywhere use case we want to

commit_message:
Add support for native TLS encryption on NBD for disk migration

The NBD protocol previously runs in clear text, offering no security
protection for the data transferred, unless it is tunnelled over some
external transport like SSH. Such tunnelling is inefficient and
inconvenient to manage. Support for TLS to the NBD clients & servers
provided by QEMU was added. In tls-everywhere use case we want to
take advantage of this feature to create the certificates and configure
qemu to use nbd tls.

Related-bug: 1793093
Depends-On: Ifa5cf08d5104a62c9c094e3585de33e19e265110
Change-Id: I1db1b60be4907511f0ec0f5aa0f0a45e1c5d9b45

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-23 15:32:33.000000000', 'message': 'Address python3 string issues with subprocess

Follows up Id0060a3abbcda8edb6124eb096cb824aaea48396.
This patch updates our Popen calls to enable universal newlines for
calls that we parse or consume the output for. Without
univeral_newlines=True, the output is treated as bytes under python3
which leads to issues later where we are using it as strings.

See https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html#term-universal-newlines
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I2e6adf91e63bcfe3c1daed527d40210accdc5b4e

commit_message:
Address python3 string issues with subprocess

Follows up Id0060a3abbcda8edb6124eb096cb824aaea48396.
This patch updates our Popen calls to enable universal newlines for
calls that we parse or consume the output for. Without
univeral_newlines=True, the output is treated as bytes under python3
which leads to issues later where we are using it as strings.

See https://docs.python.org/3/glossary.html#term-universal-newlines
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I2e6adf91e63bcfe3c1daed527d40210accdc5b4e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-23 10:03:18.000000000', 'message': 'Functional: Workaround database failures

This patch inherited and modified the mehtod that creates the database
for the functional tests to:

1. Make it atomic by using a lock

2. Removed the singleton nature of it. Prior to this patch, the tests
kept a single shared in-memory database. Now, each test will have its
own in-memory database.

3. Handle the DBNonExistentTable for failures in the cleanUp() method
while deleting the db tables.

Partial-Bug: #1808146
Change-Id: I90a50fe1284078f5a5719da54599d4cddc5bd06f
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 29d07bec1694b05287aa175bc4de10a5dc04965e)
'}]
commit_message:
Functional: Workaround database failures

This patch inherited and modified the mehtod that creates the database
for the functional tests to:

1. Make it atomic by using a lock

2. Removed the singleton nature of it. Prior to this patch, the tests
kept a single shared in-memory database. Now, each test will have its
own in-memory database.

3. Handle the DBNonExistentTable for failures in the cleanUp() method
while deleting the db tables.

Partial-Bug: #1808146
Change-Id: I90a50fe1284078f5a5719da54599d4cddc5bd06f
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 29d07bec1694b05287aa175bc4de10a5dc04965e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-12-13 12:33:57.000000000', 'message': "Allow libvirt to properly set-up and clean-up MACs

Libvirt has introduced a fix (at version TBD::XXXX) where on macVtap
it sets the VF netdev mac address during macVtap interface creation
and restores to the original value during macVtap interface deletion.

Remove the logic in linux_utils that was introduced as a WA fix
to allow proper cleanup.

During plug_hw_veb(), unplug_hw_veb() set/unset the VIF's MAC address
on the VF index (via PF) as neutron sriovnicswitch mechanism driver
agent relies on it to determine which ports it manages

Change-Id: If50861afe43182c14cc52b9745aab420cffaa298
"}]
commit_message:
Allow libvirt to properly set-up and clean-up MACs

Libvirt has introduced a fix (at version TBD::XXXX) where on macVtap
it sets the VF netdev mac address during macVtap interface creation
and restores to the original value during macVtap interface deletion.

Remove the logic in linux_utils that was introduced as a WA fix
to allow proper cleanup.

During plug_hw_veb(), unplug_hw_veb() set/unset the VIF's MAC address
on the VF index (via PF) as neutron sriovnicswitch mechanism driver
agent relies on it to determine which ports it manages

Change-Id: If50861afe43182c14cc52b9745aab420cffaa298

[{'created': '2019-01-28 19:08:59.000000000', 'message': "Allow setting test API microversions in gate tests

Add MANILA_TEMPEST_MIN_API_MICROVERSION and
MANILA_TEMPEST_MAX_API_MICROVERSION to the ci
post_test_hook. These options default to
the values specified in the api_version_request.py
file.  On master branch don't set these as we
want to run with the latest.

Related-bug: #1781671
Change-Id: I085ed175dfbe132c80a6a86ab34a281b3c94f5f0
"}]
commit_message:
Allow setting test API microversions in gate tests

Add MANILA_TEMPEST_MIN_API_MICROVERSION and
MANILA_TEMPEST_MAX_API_MICROVERSION to the ci
post_test_hook. These options default to
the values specified in the api_version_request.py
file.  On master branch don't set these as we
want to run with the latest.

Related-bug: #1781671
Change-Id: I085ed175dfbe132c80a6a86ab34a281b3c94f5f0

commit_message:
Update cirros image from 3.5 to 3.6

The current cirros image ssh setup fails due to lack of disk space
causing config-drive setup to fail forcing fallback to metadata
server. It is currently seen in OSA and devstack gates.
It might affect tripleo also.

Change-Id: I84a335921f3dd55c8e319c6bed260aa41201cdbb
Related-Bug: #1808010

API (GET /v2/{tenant_id}/shares/{share_id}/export_locations)
no longer provides export locations of non-active share

location details for share replicas, both active and non-active.
(GET /v2/{tenant_id}/share-replicas/{share_replica_id}/export-locations)

The new API provides the replica's ID, state and availability zone
in addition to the export location information.

commit_message:
Separate APIs for share & replica export locations

Users of replicated shares expect to see primary
export locations when viewing information regarding
the share. Because we collate exports of all replicas
within the export locations APIs, it becomes hard for
users to discern which exports belong to the primary
share. For secondary replicas, users would also need
additional information (availability zone, state of the
replication) to work with.

Introduce micro-version 2.47 from which the export locations
API (GET /v2/{tenant_id}/shares/{share_id}/export_locations)
no longer provides export locations of non-active share
replicas. A new API has been introduced to provide export
location details for share replicas, both active and non-active.
(GET /v2/{tenant_id}/share-replicas/{share_replica_id}/export-locations)

The new API provides the replica's state and availability zone
in addition to the export location information.

APIImpact
Implements: bp export-locations-az
Change-Id: I0a1d9dd00b4c13ac01988e30ca2b7d7ce4a747d1

subject: Blacklist setuptools 40.7.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-01-28 19:17:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-28 19:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

queens is the first branch hit by this, rocky+ is fine?

can you confirm?'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2019-01-28 21:42:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This error comes in case of calling "python setup.py build_sphinx" when base python is 2.7.

As far as I saw in stable periodic jobs the only stable branches where we hit this problem is queens, pike and ocata.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-01-28 22:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

ok, just calling it out so we can vote properly'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-01-29 00:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-28 19:17:05.000000000', 'message': "Blacklist setuptools 40.7.0

Setuptools 40.7.0 introduced support for non-ascii chars in setup.cfg [1],
which causes python2.7 based sphinx jobs to fail with str-unicode mismatch,
e.g. with [2]:

'error: 'builder' must be a list of strings (got u'html,man')

See issue [3].

[1] https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/history.html#v40-7-0
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/keystone/stable/queens/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/0ea4957/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-28_06_18_25_401045
[3] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/1653

Change-Id: I8921639cc4a1edfa0ac9d46a7cc03549aa6189aa
"}]
commit_message:
Blacklist setuptools 40.7.0

Setuptools 40.7.0 introduced support for non-ascii chars in setup.cfg [1],
which causes python2.7 based sphinx jobs to fail with str-unicode mismatch,
e.g. with [2]:

'error: 'builder' must be a list of strings (got u'html,man')

See issue [3].

[1] https://setuptools.readthedocs.io/en/latest/history.html#v40-7-0
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/keystone/stable/queens/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/0ea4957/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-01-28_06_18_25_401045
[3] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/1653

Change-Id: I8921639cc4a1edfa0ac9d46a7cc03549aa6189aa

commit_message:
Update v3 identity project tag test to work w/ pre-prov

I don't see any limitations by using pre-provisioned
credentials for these test:

* test_list_update_delete_project_tags

By setting force_tenant_isolation=False these tests now be
can executed with backends that don't allow user creation
(immutable user source) like LDAP.

Change-Id: I04a0a00b8a33686038754f32c2f722e0e522fc4d

commit_message:
support http/https proxy for discovery url

HTTP(S) proxy can be specified when creating the template.

https://docs.openstack.org/magnum/latest/admin/magnum-proxy.html

However, it is not being utilized when talking to a public etcd discovery
service, which result in failed cluster creation. We need to be able to
use HTTP(S) proxy when services are running behind a firewall.

NOTE: this patch also updated some test cases to explicitly set
the proper HTTP status code in the mock HTTP request as by default
they are not be initialized, which caused those tests to fail.

Change-Id: I13d86b0dc7c232a51149107f0412219388d8c2cd
story: 2004664
(cherry picked from commit ffc61816c8cf7d6d3f1129b0d520a661b3b8cddf)

commit_message:
Enable ETCD_USE_RAMDISK in Kuryr gates

Option listed above will make the data directory of etcd deployed by
DevStack to be a ramfs RAM disk, which should greatly help with
Kubernetes instability by reducing fsync durations.

Change-Id: I9543c1b7aa41e10b64996b0d705593521f46b8b2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/626885

commit_message:

to copy it during the %install phase.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/633526

commit_message:
Add provider driver capabilities API

This patch adds an API that allows operators to query a provider driver
for the list of supported flavor capabilities.

Change-Id: Ia3d62acdc3b1af2e666f58d32a06d2238706dee6

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/octavia/tree/octavia/amphorae/backends/agent/agent_jinja_cfg.py#n61
I think we should rebuild amphora-agent config file when the flavor specified a different topology.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-01-21 19:43:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

I don't think so. You can't update a flavor. It is only set at LB boot time and cannot be changed after it is in use by at least one load balancer."}, {'account_id': 28329, 'date': '2019-01-21 21:03:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 30:

Sorry, I didn't make myself clear.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589292/
Reference above patch, the amphora need know the topology of it's LB. Currently, Octavia gets the value from configuration file and pass it to amphora-agent.conf when boot the amphora. I mean if we use flavor to set a value different from the one in the configuration file, the amphora will get a unmatched value about topology. And, If we used spares, Maybe, we need rewrite the amphora-agent configuration file in amphora."}, {'account_id': 28329, 'date': '2019-01-22 06:38:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

Hi Michael, I commit a patch for this problem.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632242/'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-01-22 16:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

Ah, I understand now.
Thank you for the patch, but I think we can do this an easier way.
I will post a new version of this patch today.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-01-22 20:43:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

Part 1 of the fix for this is here:
https://review.openstack.org/632551'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2019-01-23 23:02:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

[{'created': '2018-12-01 02:00:02.000000000', 'message': 'Adds flavor support to the amphora driver

This patch adds support for flavor metadata validation by the amphora driver
and support for setting the load balancer topology via a flavor.
It also adds "flavor_id" to the load balancer table in the database.

Change-Id: I8eae870abdb20dc32917957e32606deef387ec88

commit_message:
Adds flavor support to the amphora driver

This patch adds support for flavor metadata validation by the amphora driver
and support for setting the load balancer topology via a flavor.
It also adds "flavor_id" to the load balancer table in the database.

Change-Id: I8eae870abdb20dc32917957e32606deef387ec88

commit_message:
Add flavors/flavor_profile api-ref

This patch adds the api-ref updates for the new flavors and flavor profile
API.

Change-Id: I11ab9af188731a1eaf1f402c4d55a944dc85ea88

commit_message:
Add flavor, flavor_profile table and their APIs

This patch adds flavor and flavor_profile tables.
It also implements flavors and flavorprofiles apis.

Partially-Implements: Blueprint octavia-lbaas-flavors
Co-Authored-By: Michael Johnson <johnsomor@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I99a673438458757d0acdaa46dd8ee041edb3be9c

commit_message:
Use template for lower-constraints

Small cleanups:

* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual
  jobs.
* Sort list of templates

Change-Id: I432310cdede37a00be894541fff7f23bc10220f5
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/623229

subject: replace legacy-manila-publishimage-generic job
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-22 10:58:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-22 12:20:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Makes sense,but I'd rather see others review first, to see the full impact of the change (basically check if there is nothing missing there). A grep says it's okay though."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-01-23 23:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-01-24 16:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-24 20:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-01-29 01:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think this needs a little explanation.

The old job legacy-manila-publishimage-generic still seems to be active in the release pipeline[1] and the new job is active on the post pipeline[2].  This feels like a problem to me

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/zuul.d/projects.yaml#n4961
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/manila-image-elements/tree/.zuul.yaml#n28'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-29 02:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I think this needs a little explanation.

> The old job legacy-manila-publishimage-generic still seems to be 
> active in the release pipeline[1] and the new job is active on
> the post pipeline[2].  This feels like a problem to me

We're trying to move the old job in-tree (where it is now native zuul-v3) and clean up in the more central repos.

None of the clean-up is a rush, and I may not have set up the depends-on's correctly.  If so, please advise.

BTW, manila-image-elements appears to never really "release".  It does publish artifacts. ((And none of that was my doing, but I'm current manila PTL).

We have:

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631846/  in-tree manila, publishing-artifacts, all that we really need except legacy job cleanup.

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632412/  project-config cleanup
  
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632411/  this-review, openstack/releases cleanup

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632362/ openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs cleanup

I think the last of these ought to depend on the project-config cleanup but I'm unclear on the depends-on relationship between the project-config cleanup and the openstack-releases cleanup.

Please advise :)'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-01-29 05:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> > I think this needs a little explanation.
 > 
 > > The old job legacy-manila-publishimage-generic still seems to be
 > > active in the release pipeline[1] and the new job is active on
 > > the post pipeline[2].  This feels like a problem to me
 > 
 > We're trying to move the old job in-tree (where it is now native
 > zuul-v3) and clean up in the more central repos.
 > 
 > None of the clean-up is a rush, and I may not have set up the
 > depends-on's correctly.  If so, please advise.
 > 
 > BTW, manila-image-elements appears to never really "release".  It
 > does publish artifacts. ((And none of that was my doing, but I'm
 > current manila PTL).

Thanks for calrifying that.  Given that you don't ever actually tag releases for manila-image-elements in this repo it's all a little strange ;P

 > 
 > We have:
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/631846/  in-tree manila,
 > publishing-artifacts, all that we really need except legacy job
 > cleanup.
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632412/  project-config cleanup
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632411/  this-review,
 > openstack/releases cleanup
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/c/632362/ openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs
 > cleanup

Ideally 632362 would depends-on 632411 which would depends-on 632412, which would depends-on 631846.  That isn't quite what you have but as you don't ever tag releases here it doesn't really matter.  What you have wont break anything :D

 > I think the last of these ought to depend on the project-config
 > cleanup but I'm unclear on the depends-on relationship between the
 > project-config cleanup and the openstack-releases cleanup.
 > 
 > Please advise :)

Looks okay to me.  Thanks Tom'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-01-29 07:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> > > I think this needs a little explanation.
 > >

 > be

 > strange ;P

 > > We have:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-21 19:26:44.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce device_exists() calls

The updating of arp entries was always calling device.exists()
which is wrapping a "ip netns exec.. ip link show" which is significant
overhead. We can be opportunistic and assume the device exists. Although
we could simply recheck whether the device exists on failure, this would
introduce a TOCTOU race, so we rather don't want to do that.

Change-Id: I92a0d8d1d313f7a47be06d6ca35f0430295ebafc
'}, {'created': '2019-01-22 13:05:53.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce device_exists() calls

The updating of arp entries was always calling device.exists()
which is wrapping a "ip netns exec.. ip link show" which is measurable
overhead. For "add" we can assume (since it does actually a ip neigh
replace, aka is idempotent) that it only fails when the device isn't
there. For delete, we can preserve existing checks.

Although we could simply recheck whether the device exists on failure,
this would introduce a TOCTOU race, so we don't do that and assume
the failure was due to the device missing, and record it.

Change-Id: I92a0d8d1d313f7a47be06d6ca35f0430295ebafc
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce device_exists() calls

The updating of arp entries was always calling device.exists()
which is wrapping a "ip netns exec.. ip link show" which is measurable
overhead. For "add" we can assume (since it does actually a ip neigh
replace, aka is idempotent) that it only fails when the device isn't
there. For delete, we can preserve existing checks.

Although we could simply recheck whether the device exists on failure,
this would introduce a TOCTOU race, so we don't do that and assume
the failure was due to the device missing, and record it.

Change-Id: I92a0d8d1d313f7a47be06d6ca35f0430295ebafc

commit_message:
WIP - Support terminated parameter in List and Get Allocation API

The List and Get Allocation API allows cloud admin to add query
terminated parameter. When the parameter is spcified the two APIs
returns terminated allocations as well as active and pending
allocations.

Change-Id: I5fbdad1e6421775fc90a0f1bc13f7c0be638ae24

[{'created': '2019-01-24 22:22:02.000000000', 'message': 'Change DHCP agent to log message after failure

If the DHCP agent fails to send its report_state
to the server, it logs an exception:

   Failed reporting state!: MessagingTimeout: Timed out...

If it then tries a second time and succeeds it just
goes on happily. It would be nice if it logged that
it had success on the subsequent attempt so someone
looking at the logs know it recovered.

Change-Id: Ia17fe39e3e4aee5727329504337dc229e0b7242f
'}]
commit_message:
Change DHCP agent to log message after failure

If the DHCP agent fails to send its report_state
to the server, it logs an exception:

   Failed reporting state!: MessagingTimeout: Timed out...

If it then tries a second time and succeeds it just
goes on happily. It would be nice if it logged that
it had success on the subsequent attempt so someone
looking at the logs know it recovered.

Change-Id: Ia17fe39e3e4aee5727329504337dc229e0b7242f
